loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon V. is from the city of Santa Cruz, Tangub City. She is 45 years old. Corazon is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a motorcycle transport service. Corazon has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Corazon joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. 

Corazon is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP which will be used to repair an existing vehicle for better service. This will be her 3rd loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Rolan

texts.en:
Rolan R. is from the city of Tangub City. He is 35 years old. Rolan is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, he operates a family member's business, running a general store where he sells a variety of different products in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over ten years and earns approximately $75 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rolan joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase canned goods, noodles and rice to sell. This will be his 1st loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, noodles and rice to sell

loans.name: Esnairah

texts.en:
Esnairah R. is from the city of Gango, Ozamiz City. She is 24 years old and single. To make a living, she owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling mobile phone accessories in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $238 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Esnairah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 20,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products like bags and home decor for sale. This will be her 1st loan from GDMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like bags and home decor to sell

loans.name: Alex

texts.en:
Alex R. is from the village of Poblacion 2, Clarin, Misamis Occidental. He is 50 years old. Alex is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, he operates a family member's business venture in the services sector, providing soft drinks delivery services in the local community. Alex has been engaged in his business for over four years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

Alex joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Alex has successfully repaid a previous loan from GDMPC. 

Alex is requesting a new loan of 6,000 PHP which will be used to repair a transport vehicle used in the business. This will be his 5th loan from GDMPC. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches  covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair a transport vehicle used in the business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more poultry

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma D., from the city of Gala, Ozamis City, is 46 years old, married, and has 10 grown children. To make a living, Elma has been planting and harvesting a variety of vegetables for sale for over two years, earning approximately 5000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Elma joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan from GDMPC, she is now requesting her second loan for 15000 PHP to purchase more seedlings and fertilizers. Elma plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About GDMPC:

GDMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in Mindanao, Philippines. It has seven branches covering the provinces of Zamboanga del Sur, Lanao del Norte and Misamis Occidental. Its membership is composed mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional seedlings and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pestcides and other farm inputs for increased productivity.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 49 years old, married and has five children.

In 2009 Ahmad opened his own bookstore where he sells stationery items. He has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2400 loan to repair the wall of the store and to renovate it from inside. He is aiming to increase his sales so he will be able to expand in the future.

loans.use: To repair the wall of the shop and to renovate it from inside.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for his farm

loans.name: Ablan Novignon

texts.fr: Mère d’un(01) enfant, Madame Ablan  est âgée de 44ans et réside à Hédzranawoé (un quartier du Togo). Elle est revendeuse de charbon de bois. Elle a démarré en 2000 son activité, s’approvisionne au Nord du Togo et revend devant sa maison.  Elle sollicite ce prêt pour acheter  du charbon de bois pour  réaliser du profit afin d’assurer un avenir meilleur à son enfant (vu qu’elle prend en charge ce dernier), s’épanouir, et pourquoi pas construire sa propre maison.
texts.en:
Mrs. Ablan is a 44-year-old mother of one child. She lives in Hédzranawoé (a district of Togo). She sells charcoal, an activity she started in 2000. She stocks up in northern Togo and conducts her sales from her home. 

She is requesting this loan to buy charcoal. She wants to make a profit that will allow her to provide a better future for her dependent child, to blossom, and maybe even to build her own house.

loans.use: to buy charcoal for resale

loans.name: Massan

texts.fr: Mariée à un assureur, Massan à 37ans et est mère de 02 enfants. Il ya de cela 04ans qu’elle a démarré son activité(vente des oeufs et des ustensiles de cuisine. L’achat se fait au grand marché de Lomé et la revente  à son domicile. Elle veut avoir sa boutique de vente, assurer un bon avenir à ses enfants, aider son mari et ajouter à cet te activité une autre pour réaliser plus de bénéfices.  Elle à payer  son premier  prêt  sans difficulté et elle sollicite ce second pour acheter des œufs et des ustensiles de cuisines.
texts.en:
Massan is a 37-year-old mother of two children, and married to an insurer. She launched her activity four years ago. She sells eggs and kitchen tools. She buys her stocks at the grand market of Lomé and conducts her sales from her home. 

She wants to have her own shop, provide a better future for her children, help her husband, and start a secondary activity in order to increase her profits.  

She repaid her first loan without difficulty, and is now seeking this second loan to buy eggs and cooking utensils.

loans.use: to buy eggs and cooking utensils

loans.name: Hadjidjérou

texts.fr: Madame I. a 41ans. Elle est mère de 04enfants et est mariée à un chauffeur. Il ya de cela 25ans qu’elle exerce cette activité (vente de tissus coupons). Elle s’approvisionne au Grand marché de Lomé et revend au même lieu. Ce premier prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter plus de marchandises pour réaliser d’énormes profits  afin d’assurer un meilleur avenir à ses enfants, et aider son mari qui est chauffeur.
texts.en: Ms. I. is 41 years old. She is the mother of four children and married to a driver. For 25 years, she has been working in this business (selling cuts of cloth). She gets her supplies at the Grand Market of Lomé and resells them at the same place. This initial loan she is requesting will enable her to buy more merchandise for making enormous profits. This is to ensure a better future for her children and to help her husband, who is a driver.

loans.use: to buy cut cloth.

loans.name: Marthen

texts.en:
Marthen is a 39-year-old entrepreneur. He lives in Oebufu Village, Kupang City. Marthen is married to Rince, a 38-year-old lady, and they have four children. The children are 	Astriana, 12 years old, who is in the sixth grade of elementary school; Yoprianus, 9 years old, who is in the fourth grade of elementary school; Aldi, 5 years old, who is in kindergarten, and Deni, 3 years old, who is not at school yet.
 
Marthen has a kiosk business that helps him in supporting his family. Even so, the income is not sufficient to fully meet his family needs. As Marthen is the only income source for his family, he also sells agricultural products in the market. He buys the agricultural products from the farmers and resells it at the market. Marthen sells vegetables, potatoes, cassava, sweet potatoes, pineapples and bananas. 

Due to the limited capital that he has, Marthen cannot buy agricultural products in bulk to resell.

Marthen dreams of developing a small building next to his kiosk to sell the crops. He will be happy because then he will not need to sell the vegetable in the market. He also wishes that he could buy agricultural products at bulk prices.
 
To make his dream come true, Marthen is requesting a loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM. He plans to spend the loan to buy more vegetables and to develop a small building to sell vegetables. He is hoping that TLM will help him in making his dream come true.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables and to develop a small building to sell vegetables

loans.name: Djariatou

texts.fr: Madame Djariatou a 34ans. Elle à de 03enfants et est mariée à un commerçant. Il ya de cela 21ans qu’elle exerce cette activité (vente de tissus coupons). Elle s’approvisionne au Grand marché de Lomé et revend au même lieu. Ce premier prêt qu’elle sollicite lui permettra d’acheter plus de marchandises pour réaliser d’énormes profits  afin d’assurer un meilleur avenir à ses enfants, et aider son mari.
texts.en:
Mrs. Djariatou is 34 years old. She has three children, and is married to a merchant.  She started to sell fabric remnants 21 years ago. She buys her stock at the grand market of Lomé, where she also conducts her sales. 

This first loan will allow her it to buy more merchandise and make huge profits to provide a better future for her children and help her husband.

loans.use: to buy fabric remnants

loans.name: Magrina

texts.en:
Magrina J. K. is a woman of 38 years, married and the mother of three children. They live in Leltot, in Eldoret. She does maize farming in the same area and has been in this business for 11 years. She gets a monthly income of 12,000 KES.

This will be Magrina's second loan with KADET Ltd. She repaid her other loan successfully. 

She plans to use the entire loan to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, maize seeds, etc. With the income she is going to get from selling the maize, she plans to pay school fees for her children. 

In the future, she wants to buy one more acre of land and also educate her children.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizers, maize seeds, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy beans and maize

loans.name: Agalyawamu Busimbi Members Group

texts.en:
Sylivia W., 39,  is a level-headed and tenacious lady who set forth in her food sales business venture in Kiganywa-Mityana at the threshold of 2009. 

Sylivia, a happy-go-lucky mother of four, says her husband's moral support spawned the establishment and growth of her business, in which, for the most part, she is engaged in selling maize, cassava and beans. 

Monthly, she says, this business generates 240,000 UGX as profit. With this loan, she says she is going to purchase more bags of maize to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more maize to resell

loans.name: Anetou

texts.fr: Agée de 41ans, Mme Aneto est revendeuse de jus de fruit. Mariée à un chauffeur, elle est mère de 03 enfants.  Elle est dans l’activité cela fait 11ans. Elle achète les matières premières au Grand marché de Lomé après transformation en jus elle les vend à son domicile. Madame Aneto veut assurer l’avenir de ses enfants c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce troisième prêt pour acheter les matières premières (arome, sucre, citron…) afin de réaliser plus de profit.
texts.en:
Mrs. Anetou sells fruit juices. She is 41 years old, married to a driver, and the mother of three children. She started this activity 11 years ago. She buys her supplies at the grand market of Lomé, and after making the juice, she sells it from her home. 

Mrs. Anetou wants to provide for her children’s future, which is why she is seeking this third loan. She will buy the necessary supplies (extract, sugar, lemon, etc.) to increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy extract, sugar, and lemon

loans.name: Déborah

texts.fr: Mariée à un transporteur, Déborah a 05 enfants et est âgée de 38ans. Elle réside à Kélégougan (un quartier situé environ  à une dizaine de km de la ville de Lomé).  Elle est dans la vente de mais il ya de cela 9ans. Elle fait son approvisionnement au marché de l’intérieur et revend dans sa maison  à Kélégougan. Elle a des ambitions : avoir un magasin pour mieux vendre, faire d’autres activités, assurer un avenir meilleur à ses enfants, aider en partie son mari et s’épanouir. Elle demande ce prêt pour acheter plus de céréales  et des pagnes pour vendre afin d’avoir plus de bénéfices pour réaliser son rêve.
texts.en:
Deborah is 38 years old. She has five children, and she is married to a transporter. She lives in Kélégougan, a neighborhood located about 10 km from the city of Lomé. 

She started selling maize 9 years ago. She stocks up at the inland market and conducts her sales from her home in Kélégougan. She wants to have a store in order to increase her sales, launch other activities, provide her children with a better future, help her husband, and flourish. 

She is seeking this loan to purchase more grain as well as pagnes (printed cloth), which will increase her profits and help her to achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy maize and pagnes

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more Irish potatoes and motorcycle spare parts

loans.name: Abra Emefa

texts.fr: Agée de 59ans, Mme Emefa a 05 enfants et est mariée à un retraité.  Elle est dans le domaine de la vente d’habits de prêt à porter  il ya 34ans. Elle achète ses marchandises chez les dames qui viennent de la Chine et revend au grand marché de Lomé. Elle n’a pas eu de difficultés pour  payer ce premier prêt c’est pour cela elle sollicite encore ce montant pour acheter  plus de marchandises  pour vendre et avoir plus de bénéfices
texts.en:
Mrs. Emefa is 59 years old and has five children. Her husband is retired. She started selling ready to wear clothing 34 years ago. Her suppliers are ladies from China, and she conducts her sales at the grand market of Lomé. 

Having repaid her first loan without difficulties, she is seeking a new loan in the same amount to acquire more merchandise and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy ready to wear clothing for resale

loans.name: Vich

texts.en:
Vich V., age 37, is a farmer residing in the rural area of Kompong Tom province. She keeps pigs in a pigpen behind her house. Every four months, she sells these to a slaughterer. In addition to this cyclical income, she has an annual business of planting and harvesting rice crops. Her husband works in construction. They have five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory as sewing workers.

Sot Vanny is looking for a loan to use as capital to support her farming business. She will use the loan to buy additional piglets and to buy cashews to offer for sale in order to gain additional income and profit.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets and to buy cashews to offer for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a used motor-trailer taxi so that her son can begin a service business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more dry produce for resale

loans.name: Oyuntsetseg

texts.en:
Oyuntsetseg is a 41-year-old woman who lives with her husband and four children in a house in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. Her husband is a blind lama who instructs his believers at his home. Unfortunately, her older daughter is a disabled lady at the age of 22. Her youngest, age 9, is a pupil and other two, age 16 and 20, attend college. 

Oyuntsetseg manages a clothing trading business in her town. She started her business in 2007. She rents an outdoor stall during warm seasons because of the low rent cost. She travels to Ereen, border city of China, once or twice in a month in order to import her goods. She is very good at picking out most qualified and stylish clothes and people of all ages are happy to buy from her booth. 

As her business has become stable and profitable, she is planning to go to Beijin, capital city of China, to collect many more stylish clothes in order to boost her sales. She is an open-minded and polite woman who attributes her business success to her good communication skills. She says, "I have a big dream and I am trying hard to fulfill my big dream." She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase wide variety of clothes from Beijin city.

loans.use: to purchase a wide variety of clothes

loans.name: Enhtuya

texts.en:
Enhtuya is 20 years old and lives with her mother in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Govi-Altai province, Mongolia. Her mother is in her retirement with monthly earning of 123,000 MNT. 

Enhtuya operates a grocery trading business out of a rented stall in a grocery store. She started her business in January 2010 with working capital of 700,000 MNT. Even in that short period of time, she has managed to establish her business. Now her working capital exceeds 1,700,000 MNT.

She is planning to rent one more stall starting in July 2011. She is a diligent and open-minded lady who possesses lots of good personality. She says, "I want to buy an apartment in the future." She is requesting a 3,200,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery items for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items

loans.name: Munhbat

texts.en:
Munhbat is 34 years old and lives with his wife and three children in a ger, a Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Hovd province, Mongolia. His daughter and two sons all attend the local secondary school. 

He is a carpenter who manages a wooden-product-making business in cooperation with his wife. Munhbat started his business in 2004 in his backyard. As a carpenter, he needs a,big space where he can make household wooden products such as chairs, beds and tables. etc. His wife is in charge of selling goods at a rented stall at a local market. 

Their products are well-known amongst residents of Hovd province. Munhbat is a polite man who is planning to improve his workshop and to increase the quantity of his products. He says, "I want to open a big factory, which will provide a wide collection of wooden products for Hovd residents." He is requesting a 1,700,000 MNT loan to purchase wood for his business.

loans.use: to purchase wood

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, hair extensions, and lengths of African-print cloth.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a refrigerator to store fruit, a blender and some wood to build a small table

loans.name: Nyamdavaa

texts.en:
Nyamdavaa M. is a 57-year-old man who lives with his wife and four children in a house in Hovd province, Mongolia. His older son lives and works in Korea in order to help to pay the education fee of his youngest brother and sister. His youngest three children attend college. His wife is a nurse who helps with the family business in her spare time. 

Nyamdavaa manages a clothing trading business in his town. He started his business in 2000 out of a rented stall at a Buyan, one of the biggest markets in his town. With 11 years of business operation, he has gained much experience and is well-known among his customers. He is a diligent man who is planning to expand his business in the future. 

He is requesting a loan of 800,000 MNT to import more stylish clothes from China.

loans.use: to import more stylish clothes from China

loans.name: Suzy

texts.en:
Suzy F. is currently in the business of selling greens. 

She is 22 years old, married, and has three children. Two of them go to school. 

Suzy borrowed a loan to stock more greens to sell. 

In the future, she hopes to build a concrete house with the extra profits from her business.

loans.use: to stock more greens to sell

loans.name: Nurali

texts.ru: Хамидов Нурали проживает в районе Фархор. Ему 32 года. Он женат, имеет 4 детей. У него среднее образование. Более 6 лет занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи для продажи. Кредит берет для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Nurali H. lives in the Farkhor region.  He's 32, married, and has 4 children.  He has a high school education.  For more than 6 years he has earned his living growing crops, mostly vegetables, to sell.  He plans to use his loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Shiijav

texts.en:
Shiijav G. is 45 years old and lives with her husband and their only daughter in their own house in Hovd province, Mongolia. 

Her husband is unemployed and her daughter goes to a local secondary school. 

Shiijav operates a meat trading business in her town. She was a cook who quit her career in order to feed her family during a transition period. She has been managing her business for five years and is planning to continue in the future. 

During her business operation she managed to stabilize her business and built a good relationship with both her customers and her partners. She possesses a good personality. 

She is requesting a 2,800,000 MNT of loan to purchase more meat for her business.

loans.use: to purchase more meat

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Mukhidin

texts.en:
Mukhidin I. is a hard-working man who feeds his cattle early each day. He started his business with one animal and gradually increased the number of his cattle. Today he has five cattle in his business. 

He is requesting a loan of 7,000 TJS to purchase cattle and expand his business. 

Mukhidin is very grateful to everyone who is helping him achieve success in his business with this loan. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International:
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes having been a key post along the Silk Road and having witnessed the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to epic mountain passes, a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC, and communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still lives in abject poverty.

IMON's History:
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David T. is married and lives with his family in Zestaponi District, in the village of Meore Sviri. David is 43 years old. He has two children: a 16-year-old daughter and a 14-year-old son. Both of them go to school. Agricultural activities are the main source of income for the family. In particular, they have two milk cows, whose milk is used for cheese. The cheese is sold on the local market. The family also has a vineyard, 0.8 ha. The sale of grapes is an additional seasonal source of income. Along with the above-mentioned, the family runs small poultry farm. The chickens are sold every 40-50 days.  

With the requested amount David plans to expand the poultry farm. He will purchase chickens and feed for them. This will result in increased sales and thus increased income for the family. The increase in income will be used for renovation of their house.

loans.use: to purchase chickens and feed for them.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion G., a CCT* community partner, is a simple woman with a simple dream in life. At 57, she had earned a degree in college and is running a household with her husband Romeo, a tricycle (three-wheeled transport) driver. They have three children: one who is still studying in high school, and two who are already working. They live as a family in Dasmarinas, Cavite.

Her current focus is on making her sari-sari (variety) store survive competition and level up into something like a grocery. Weekly she observes which products sell the most and which brands are the most in demand. Aside from her sari-sari store, she also has a mineral water business. Monthly, Salvacion earns approximately Php 9,500.

To help her advance her business, Salvacion is applying for a loan amounting to Php 19,000. She will buy more quick-selling items such as toiletries, canned goods, and instant noodles to add to her inventory of products. She sees this as a sure way to increase her profits over time.

Salvacion simply dreams of getting away from poverty and giving her family a prosperous life. She desires that as her business grows with the application of every entrepreneurial skill and the spiritual support CCT gives her, every member of her family will experience not only happiness, but joy that transcends all circumstances.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: purchase of more merchandise for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Stock more maize to sell.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
A product line that never ceases to gain regular customers is one that serves the food market. Sarah M., 62, banks on this fact and runs a food micro-enterprise. Sarah is married to Wilfredo, a driver, and together they have raised children who are now in college. Sarah is out to prove that having finished only three years of high school does not limit her in business.

At present, Sarah runs a food stall, called a "carinderia", in the Philippines. The carinderia is annexed to their house, so she is able to manage both the household chores and the daily routines in the carinderia. This business of hers has been running for 15 years now, and with the diligence she puts into her work and the quality training and spiritual support she receives from CCT*, Sarah manages to earn Php 15,000 net income every month. She has one employee hired to help her with the daily tasks in her carinderia.

Because Sarah aims to serve nothing but quality food to her customers, she decided to borrow Php 10,000 to better finance her business. She intends to use this loan money to purchase meat products, vegetables, and other nutritious ingredients to come up with daily sumptuous meals. With this loan, Sarah is also equipped to meet the daily needs of her family and pay for the tuition fees of her children.

One challenge Sarah faces is the competition she has in the community, since there are not a few business-minded people like her who have set up food stalls in the vicinity. But Sarah is not going to give up the fight. She holds on to the hope of making her business grow, so that she may be able to finance the education of her children up to college and take care of the family's health.

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she receives.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay micro finance loans.

loans.use: purchase of daily ingredients and condiments.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy palm oil, rice, peppers, onions, cooking oil, Maggi, etc. in large quantity.

loans.name: Estrella

texts.en:
Estrella M. is a micro entrepreneur who sees her business as a God-given opportunity to produce wealth. She is 58 years old, and since she runs her own business, the fact that she only reached high school does not seem that important. Estrella is married to Angelo, who runs his own business. They have two children, one of whom is at home while the other works for a living. The family used to live in Pangasinan, but now they reside in Pasay City.

Estrella runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She runs her store from her home which gives her the ability to manage both her store and house without missing details. She has run her store for the past two-and-a-half years and now she knows what her customers need and want, down to the specific brands and products. Estrella earns 10,000 PHP each month, based on her experience and entrepreneurial learning from CCT*.

Estrella is requesting a 29,000 PHP loan to expand her business. She will use the loan to buy sacks of rice to sell and to purchase groceries to add to her inventory. Her loan will help her increase her daily income and better meet the needs of her family. Above all else, she sees that the blessings she receives in business are God’s favor upon her and so she depends even more upon the Lord.

With God’s help, Estrella does not have any life challenges at present. According to her, there is no challenge too hard to bear when you pray to God. It is Estrella’s desire to be able to serve the Lord full time. As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group’s weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she received.


*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase rice and groceries

loans.name: Salavmat

texts.en:
S. Salavmat is married and the loving mother of five children. For the past five years, she has been in the clothing business, selling clothes in the market at Ganj. S. is a hardworking businesswoman who earns a good living. She buys her goods from the market at Korvon and has regular customers. Her husband helps her in the business. 

S. is requesting a loan of 5,000 TJS to purchase new fashionable quality goods which will allow her to attract more customers. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great’s rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, has epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the USSR, further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients present a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Said

texts.ru: Убайдов Саид проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 34 года. Женат, имеет 4 детей. Образование-среднее. Вместе с женой занимается растениеводством. Он арендует участок земли, где сеет пшеницу и выращивает арбуз, дыню, овощи. Уже год как занимается этим видом деятельности. Кредит берет для закупа семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Said U. lives in the Farkhor region.  He's 34, and married with 4 children.  He is a high school graduate.  He and his wife grow crops for a living.  He rents his fields, where he sows wheat, and grows watermelon, melons, and vegetables.  He's been doing this for a year.  He plans to use his loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and mineral fertilizers.

loans.name: Hamlet

texts.en:
Hamlet A. is 44 years old. He lives in Tsovagugh village, in the area of Sevan, with his wife and two children. Both of his children attend school. Since 1991, Hamlet has worked in animal husbandry and he breeds cows and raises calves on his farm. His wife helps him with his work and they are able to sustain their family and improve their farm as much as possible.

Hamlet is requesting a 500,000 AMD loan to buy three calves for his farm. This will increase his income in the future.

loans.use: to buy calves

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 33 years old. She is a member of the Furaha group in Faulu Kenya and is a businesswoman. Since 2006, Mary has run a tailoring business. She is able to run her business well because she received training from Faulu Kenya about how to keep business records. 

Mary has applied for a loan of 80,000 KES to buy a sewing machine and fabric. In the future, she would like to export horticultural products.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a sewing machine

loans.name: Izolda

texts.en:
Izolda L. lives in Zestaponi District, in the village of Meore Sviri. She is a 55-year-old single mother and has two sons and one daughter. Her younger son is 8 years old and her daughter is 12 years old. They go to school. The elder son is 33 years old and works as handicraftsman on house renovations. Izolda has two cows and produces cheese. Her cheese is sold on a weekly basis in Tbilisi (the capital city of the country). Also the family has vineyards with a total area of 1.6 ha. Harvested grapes are sold locally. 

With the requested credit, Izolda will buy three calves and raise them. After a year she will be able to get up to 150% more milk and increase the sales of cheese. This will positively impact the income of the family. Izolda hopes that she will be able to do some renovation work in her house, to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase three calves.

loans.name: Andrew S. Bangura Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a Kiva partner in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you the teachers of the RC Primary School from Binkolo village, near Makeni. RC Primary School was founded in September 1980 by the Catholic Mission to educate the pupils of the chiefdom. RC Primary School Binkolo has 33 teachers and 1,036 pupils. The group is applying for its first loan from SMT/Kiva lenders.

Andrew S. B. is the leader of this group of teachers. He is 50 years old and was born in the village of Marampa. Andrew is married and has five children, three of whom are in primary school and two who are in secondary school. With his share of this loan, Andrew will invest in agriculture and will buy rice and palm seeds to plant on his farm.

loans.use: to buy rice and palm seeds to plant

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy second-hand clothes and handbags.

loans.name: Sherozjon

texts.en:
H. Sherozjon is married and the father of two children. He lives in Isfara, Tajikistan, with his family. He works at home in a special place which is built for a bakery business. In a day he cooks 2-2.5 bag of flour or 450-500 individual breads and sells bread in the market. He has been in this business for 15 years. He would like to get a loan of 6000 Somoni for purchasing flour and coal. Thanks to this loan, he will be able to grow his business further and help feed his family.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy flour and coal to bake bread.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en: Richard is 39 years old and married with two school-going children, aged 4 and 13.  He is able to provide for his family with the income he earns from his cafeteria.  He also runs a grocery for more income.  He has managed to sustain his business for five years because of the financial support he gets from Faulu Kenya.  He hopes to expand his business into wholesale in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to buy beans, maize, rice and Irish potatoes.

loans.use: To buy beans, maize, rice and Irish potatoes.

loans.name: Augustine C.'s Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the WCSL primary School, Binkolo village, near Makeni. WCSL Primary School was founded in September 1919 by the Weslyan Church of Sierra Leone Mission (WCSL) to give formal education to the children of Binkolo and its surrounding villages. Today, the school is staffed with 11 teachers and has 409 pupils. 

This is the second loan that this school has applied for from SMT/Kiva lenders. Augustine C. K. is the leader of this group of teachers. The 53-year-old Augustine was born in Binkolo village and has been in the teaching profession for 30 years now. He is married and has three children. Augustine has requested this loan in order to pay his children’s school/college fees.

loans.use: To pay his children’s school/college fees.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a mixed farmer, aged  54 and a father of eight adult children. He has been active in mixed farming for over ten years, producing tea which he sells to Kenya Tea Development Authority  and pineapples which go to the local market.

Peter has requested a loan of 50,000 KES from Kiva Partner Juhudi Kilimo to enable him to purchase a better quality breed to ensure better milk production. He says his first loan helped him purchase the first cow and has been of great help. He adds the additional income will help him meet family expenditures.

Peter, like many farmers in the region, says drought is the main undoing in farming business.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Olivia

texts.en:
Olivia L. is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is married and has five children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Olivia has a poultry firm, which she has had for over 10 years.  She also has a second business selling fruits and vegetables.  

To help expand her business, Olivia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more poultry feed for the chickens she sells.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Olivia hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Olivia hopes to open up a livestock farm.

loans.use: to purchase more poultry feed for the chickens.

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en: Josphat is a hard-working businessman who sells vehicle spare parts.  He was previously farming before he went into this business.  Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has benefited financially.  He previously serviced a loan which he used to boost his business.  He hopes to import spare parts in the future.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to buy alternators and starters.

loans.use: To buy alternators and starters.

loans.name: Djromahouton Group

texts.fr: DJROMAHOUTON est un groupe de trois personnes, dont les membres vivent ensemble et pratiquent tous la même religion. La représentante du groupe, Cyanath (qui a la main levée sur la photo), est mariée à un architecte nommé Ismaël. Le couple a trois enfants, tous scolarisés. Cyanath vit ensemble avec ses enfants et son mari au quartier Donoukin à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. Il y a près de quinze ans que la famille s'est installée dans ce quartier. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges familiales. Cyanath vend depuis sept ans déjà, divers articles à son domicile. Cyanath s'approvisionnne au Nigéria, État voisin du Bénin. C'est une ancienne cliente de ALIDé, qui a bien remboursé les crédits antérieurs. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Cyanath désire obtenir un autre financement. Plus tard, Cyanath ambitionne acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en:
DJROMAHOUTON is a group of three individuals who come together to practice the same religion. The representative of the group, Cyanath (who has her hand raised in the photo), is married to an architect named Ismaël. The couple have three children, all enrolled in school. Cyanath lives with her husband and her children in the Donoukin neighborhood in Porto-Novo, the administrative capital of Bénin. They came to live here almost 15 years ago, and the spouses share the financial responsibility for their family. 

Cyanath has been selling various items out of her home for seven years already. She buys her goods in Nigeria, a neighboring country of Bénin. She has been a client of ALIDé for a long time and has appropriately reimbursed prior loans. Wishing to bolster her business and satisfy the demand of her clientele, Cyanath has requested a new loan. Later, she hopes to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to buy hair extensions and various other products for resale.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
I. Hafiza is the loving mother of her son. She is married and her husband is an accountant in a cannery. She is engaged in animal husbandry and she has been in this business for 22 years. She purchases cattle and feeds them for a certain period then sells them at reasonable prices. For this purpose, she has applied for a loan of 4500 Somoni. She will use this loan to purchase cattle and expand her business. Let's help her reach her goals! 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy cattle.

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela N. is 25 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has one child.  Her child is not currently in school. Angela has a boutique that sells different types of cloth, which she has had for 3 years.         

To help expand her business, Angela has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more cloth for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Angela hopes to generate greater profits and buy food and also pay her house rent.  In the future, Angela hopes to open up another boutique business.

loans.use: to purchase more cloth for resale.

loans.name: Lili

texts.en:
Lili M. is 58 years old and lives in Zestaponi District, in the village of Puti. She has a 25-year-old daughter who works as an operator in a private company and earns 150 Laris per month. Another source of the income for the family comes from agricultural activities led by Lili. She has a milk cow and sells cheese at Zestaponi market. Also she grows maize on her plot of land with an area of 0.5 ha. Along with the above-mentioned, Lili has a vineyard (300 grape vines) and makes wine. Both of these products are sold in Zestaponi. 

The loan will be used to purchase one milk cow. It will result in increased amount of produced cheese and thus more income for the family. Lili and her daughter hope that the increased income will allow them to spend more on the household and improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en:
Winnie N. is 46 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala central region of Uganda.  She is single and has six children.  All of her children are currently in school.  Winnie has a poultry firm, which she has had for over 10 years.         

To help expand her business, Winnie has requested a loan of 2,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase more chicken and poultry feed.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Winnie hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for her children.  In the future, Winnie hopes to open up another poultry farm.

loans.use: to purchase more chickens and poultry feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a piece of land

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Issa

texts.en:
Issa M. is 43 years old and lives in the town of Kireka in the Kampala  central region of Uganda.  He is married and has three children.  All of his children are currently in school.  Issa has a small retail shop, which he has had for 8 years.         

To help expand his business, Issa has requested a loan of 1,500,000 Ugandan Shillings from BRAC Uganda.  The loan will be used to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.  With the help of the loan from BRAC, Issa hopes to generate greater profits and pay school fees for his children.  In the future, Issa hopes to open up a wholesale shop.

loans.use: to purchase essential commodities like sugar for resale.

loans.name: Kuvvatali

texts.ru: Хамидов Кувватали проживает в районе Фархор. Возраст, 41 год. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Вместе со всей семьей занимается растениеводством. Он арендуют земельный участок, где выращивает овощи. Этим видом деятельности занимается 20 лет. Кредит берет для покупки семян и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Kuvvatali KH. lives in Farkhor.  He is 41 years old, married, and has six children. He and his family work in agriculture.  He rents a plot of land where he grows vegetables.  He has been doing this work for twenty years. He is taking out a loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: To buy seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Hellen Apiyo

texts.en: Hellen O. is 51 years old, married and lives in the town of Migori. She and her husband have six children, all of whom are in school. For the last four years, Hellen has made a living by selling a type of sugar that is grown locally and known as "sukari nguru." She has done a great job of expanding her business and is applying for a new loan to buy more sugarcane to turn into sugar. She plans to use the additional income made possible by this loan to  improve her family's living conditions. In the future, she hopes to open a store where she can sell her goods.

loans.use: To buy sugarcane to turn into sugar

loans.name: Saoudata

texts.fr:
Saoudata est une femme qui habite au secteur 06 de Ouagadougou Burkina faso.Elle a 03 enfants. Le plus âgé a 12ans et le moins âgé a 07 ans. Deux (02) enfants  vont à l’école. Elle a quatre personnes en charge: ses 03 enfants plus sa sœur.

saoudata mène une activité de restauration (soupe de  viande de bœuf, de poisson etc.) depuis quatre ans Elle s’approvisionne au marché de zabré daaga en ville. Ses clients sont ses voisins du quartier et les fonctionnaires. 

Avec l’argent octroyé, elle veut s’acheter un congélateur pour la bonne conservation de sa viande, et 15 kilogrammes de viande
 
saoudata a pour ambition de bien embellir son  hangar, mettre des ventilateurs  et  préparer la soupe a tout moment. Elle veut réfectionner sa maison quand il pleut, l’eau rentre par le toît.
texts.en:
Saoudata is a woman who lives in Sector 6 of Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso. She has 3 children. The oldest is 12 and the youngest is 7. Two of her children go to school. She takes care of 4 people: her 3 children plus her sister.
Sadouata has been running a restaurant business selling beef stew, fish stew, and other types for the past 4 years. She purchases her supplies at the Zabré market in the city. Her clients are her neighbors, as well as civil servants.
With the loaned money, she wants to buy a freezer to keep her meat fresh and 15 kilograms of meat.
In the future, Sadiouata would like to improve her restaurant's porch by installing fans, and to be able to prepare stew at all hours of the day. She would also like to improve her home's roof because water comes in during the rainy season.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to conserve meat for her restaurant

loans.name: Rohatoy

texts.en:
Rohatoy F. is married and has three sons. She started her business with one cow but today has expanded that to three. Her sons help her with her business, which she started about 12 years ago. Rohatoy is applying for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to increase her business and the size of the herd she owns. She believes that by doing this she will generate additional income and give her family a better life. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International
Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being the home of a key post along the Silk Road and the place where the rule of Alexander the Great ended. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. Even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, Western culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. A civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93 percent of the country is mountainous and only seven percent of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History
Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients have viable business propositions. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To expand the size of her herd

loans.name: Stepan

texts.en: Stepan O. was born in 1965 in the village of Enokavan, in a part of Armenia known has Ijevan. He is married and has three sons, all of whom are in school. He makes a living by breeding animals and farming corn and oats, which he uses as fodder for his sheep. Stepan works hard to meet his family's needs and pay for the education of his sons. He is applying for a loan of 800,000 AMD to prepare for his next crop and buy feed for his animals.

loans.use: To plant his next crop and buy food for his animals.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a farmer who lives in the town of Litein in Kenya. He has been a farmer for the last 10 years and now has seven children, all of whom are in school. His main crops are maize and tea, which he sells in a local market, and his biggest challenges are drought and poor transportation. He has applied for a loan of 35,000 KES from Juhudi Kilimo to buy and insure a dairy cow. He has successfully repaid his first loan from our organization, which was for 30,000 KES. He believes that this second loan will allow him to expand his farm and increase his income.

loans.use: To buy and insure a cow

loans.name: Shaban

texts.en:
Shaban is a thirty-three-year-old married man with four children living in his own permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. He runs the family with the help of his wife who is a teacher. Their goal is to build rental houses. 

For ten years he has been in the transport sector, he started as a hired driver and later bought a taxi. He faces the challenges of a poor road network and high taxes. His dream is to buy a new taxi. Shaban intends to use the loan to service his taxi for efficiency.

loans.use: to service his taxi for efficiency

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and one sibling. He has been working in implanting solar energy systems in customers' houses since 2006. He works on a freelance basis.  He has two full-time employees helping him since his business founding, because he was unable to manage his business alone as he is working at the same time in a local hospital. 

This young man works hard in cooperation with his father to reach the necessary financial level where the family can afford the heavy life expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additional tools and products in order to expand his business operation further. He is certain that he will achieve nearer remarkable growth thanks to the loan.

loans.use: to purchase additional tools and products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new motorcycle for hire

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka B. is 30 years old. She is married and lives in the village of Kldeeti, Zestaponi District. She lives with her husband and his parents. Maka and her husband are actively involved in agricultural activities. They have three cows and sell cheese at Zestaponi Market. Besides that, the family has agricultural land with an area of 0.7 ha where they grow maize, 600 grape vines and 100 nut trees. Harvested corn and nuts are sold locally. As for the grapes, Maka and her husband make wine and sell it in Zestaponi. 

With the requested credit, Maka’s family will purchase a tractor. It will significantly reduce their costs and improve the quality of land tilling. Accordingly family will have more funds to spend on domestic needs. Maka hopes that conditions of life for her family members will go in a positive direction as a result of the loan.

loans.use: to purchase a tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 42-year-old Lebanese single man living with his parents and one sibling. He has worked in multiple restaurants and snack bars for more than 20 years.  This acquisition of experience permitted him to open his own snack bar in 2001. He started serving customers yummy sandwiches and subs such as fajitas, chicken, and beef.  

Recently, he transformed his snack bar into a diner and began to offer customers appetizers, salads, and platters. He helps his father with the household expenses. Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase supplementary food and other products. He is confident that he will always consider the demand of his customers and hopes that the loan will positively impact his business.

loans.use: to purchase supplementary food and other products.

loans.name: William

texts.en: William is 62 years old and is married with seven children.  For a living, he runs a bookshop.  He also rents out houses to earn a living.  William was previously employed as a teacher.  He went into business so that he would get enough income to meet his family’s needs.  He has requested a loan of 60,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy books and stationery.

loans.use: to buy books and stationery

loans.name: Sahira

texts.en: Sahira is currently in the business of selling tea. She is 22 years old, married, and has 3 children who all go to school. Sahira took out a loan to stock more tea to sell. She hopes to pay her children's school fees with the extra profits from her business in the future.

loans.use: to stock more tea to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married man from Lebanon. He is living with his wife and two young children. He is the manager of a small grocery store. After seeing the necessity for a higher income source, he decided to diversify his business by adding a small area in his shop where he produces fast food such as burgers, beef sandwiches etc. Despite his older age, this man contributes with all his efforts to be able to satisfy his family needs.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase new baking tools, equipment and a barbecue in order to increase his business productivity. He looks forward to generating better profits and being able to expand his business even further.

loans.use: to purchase new baking tools, equipment, and a barbecue.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials for making crafts

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a new photocopier and needed extra tools.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cereals like maize to grind into flour to sell, and also to buy poultry feed.

loans.name: Pheobe

texts.en:
Phoebe L. A. is a 49-year old married lady. She joined Faulu Kenya in 1994, and is one of its oldest members. With the help of Faulu Kenya, Phoebe has been able to sustain the tailoring business she started in 1990.

Phoebe used her previous loans from Faulu Kenya to boost her business. So far, she has employed one person to assist her in her tasks. She hopes to expand her business in the future.

Phoebe has requested a loan of 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) to buy fabric and an embroidery machine.

loans.use: To buy fabric and an embroidery machine.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a 38-year old single mother of two children. She lives in her own permanent house in Fort Portal Uganda. The responsibility to take care of five household members rests solely on her.

Elizabeth works for a tea company called Rwenzori commodities. She has been in service for 13 years. She is happy with her achievements despite the low salary scale. 

Her desire is to educate her children to university level, and she is requesting a loan to pay school fees.

loans.use: To pay school fees.

loans.name: Everline Atieno

texts.en:
Everline Atieno O. is 25 years old and comes from Migori. She is a single mother of three children. 

Everline has a business of selling onions and has been in it for the past 10 years. She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD after being introduced by a friend. She intends to buy more onions to add to her stock. 

She hopes to venture into a cereals business in the future.

loans.use: To buy more onions to add to her stock.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is 52 years old and has been in farming for the major part of her adult life, dealing mainly in milk and pineapple in the Litein area, South Rift, Kenya. She is married with 10 children, the firstborn being 23 and the last one four years old.

Esther has made a second loan request amounting to 45,000 KES to enable her to boost her dairy farming through improving her dairy unit and expanding her pineapple acreage to make production better.She says this second loan will boost her family income and make life more bearable. She predicts steady growth in her farming business.

Esther however laments poor markets for her produce but remains appreciative of Juhudi Kilimo's efforts to alleviate poverty.

loans.use: To boost both dairy and pineapple farming.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice A. is 26 years old, married to Aloyce and has four children who are all in school. The family lives in Rongo. Beatrice has a retail shop that she has been running for the past four years.

Beatrice was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is a client. She is applying for her fourth loan to enable her buy more sugar, tea leaves, detergents, etc. to add to her stock. Beatrice has a good credit history with KADET through the years as she has paid off her loans well.

Beatrice hopes to own a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To buy tea leaves, detergents, sugar etc. to add to her stock

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old married man and the father of one young child. He is from Lebanon. He is the owner of a barber shop located in his town and has 14 years of experience in this occupation; he learned this job when he was very young.  Today, he is well known in the whole region for his good business reputation. 

With his requested loan of $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l, he will perform needed maintenance on his shop and improve its decoration in order to serve his clients in a proper place. He reports that both his income and productivity will increase as a result of the loan. In the future, he is looking to further expand his business and increase his working capital.

loans.use: to perform needed maintenance on his shop and improve its decoration.

loans.name: Mirian Yaneth

texts.es: Mirian Yaneth Q. T. de 36 años de edad, vive en casa de su suegra con compañero de vida, dos hijos y una cuñada. Mirian Tiene un negocio de Venta de ropa usada ó de segunda, en donde ofrece variedad de prendas de vestir como: faldas, vestidos, blusas, pantalones, etc. Ubicado en el Centro del Municipio de Mejicanos del Departamento de San Salvador. Una zona muy transitada y conocida por los habitantes del municipio. El puesto de Mirian es muy visitado ya que las personas siempre encuentran lo que buscan y en este lugar, la amabilidad y el buen trato es lo más importante. Su sueño es ver crecer su negocio por lo que  ha decidido hacer un préstamo a INTEGRAL para poder comprar más fardos de ropa usada y tener más variedad de prendas de vestir Como: pantalones, faldas, blusas, camisetas, shorts, entre otros. Con el propósito de atraer a más compradores y lograr un mayor nivel de ventas así como un mayor nivel de ingresos.
texts.en: Mirian Yaneth Q. T., 36, lives in her mother-in-law’s house with her life partner, two children and a sister-in-law.  Mirian has a business selling second hand, used clothes where she stocks an assortment of clothing items like: skirts, dresses, blouses, pants, etc. located in downtown Mejicanos, San Salvador Department.  This is a heavily trafficked area that’s well known by local residents.  Mirian’s stand is quite popular because people always find what they are looking for there: kindness and good service which is the most important.  Her dream is that her business grows so she’s decided to do a loan in INTEGRAL to buy more bundles of used clothes and have a wider variety of items available like: pants, skirts, blouses, t-shirts and shorts, among others.  The goal is to attract more buyers and attain a higher sales level as well as higher income.

loans.use: to buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 53-year-old married woman living with her husband.  She has 15 years of experience working in the agriculture field; in 2001, she bought her land and executed her own farming work. She cultivates all types of vegetables according to the season and distributes her goods to different agricultural markets.  She cooperates with her husband who has been working as a taxi driver for 11 years, to be able to have good living conditions.  

Today, she is requesting to borrow $ 500 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy agricultural seeds and herbs in addition to an electric saw. This will allow her to better monitor her product cultivation and growth. She is very positive about her future plans and wishes to earn extra money for her family.

loans.use: buy agricultural seeds and herbs in addition to an electric saw.

loans.name: Solid Teachers Development Initiative Group

texts.en:
29-year-old M. Yahaya has been a charcoal salesman for the last two years. The married father of one transacts his business in Kikumbi, Mityana. M., who is also a primary school teacher, used to give this occupation less priority when he graduated.

It, however, dawned on M. that selling charcoal is in many ways a return value venture that is worth every effort. Yahaya still teaches, notwithstanding. Weekly he says his charcoal sales business brings in 42,000 UGX in profits.

With this loan M. says he is going to purchase more bags of charcoal to resell.

loans.use: To purchase more bags of charcoal to resell

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a twenty-six-year-old married man with two children living in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after the family. He sells used shoes for a living and has been in business for six years. The business is profitable despite the challenges in irregular sales due to the seasonal nature of the business.

Francis needs a loan to buy secondhand shoes to sell. His dream is to construct rental houses.

loans.use: To buy secondhand shoes to sell

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar M. O. is a member of Faulu Kenya with the Exodus group. He runs a private school so as to earn a living. He opened the school three years ago and has employed eight people. He runs the business in a very competitive environment; thus, he puts in extra effort.

Oscar hopes that his school becomes the best school in his area. He has requested 30,000 KES to buy lab equipment for the school.

loans.use: To buy lab equipment for the school

loans.name: Ncengani Group

texts.en:
Nomfundo Nomzamo N. is 23 years old and single with two children who are six and seven years old; only one attends school. She runs a retail business in Kwa Zulu Natal of Empangeni in South Africa. (In the photo she is dressed in red and raising her hand.)

Nomfundo's been in business for two years selling Tupperware at schools and clinics. She says that the main challenge to her business is not having a means of transport for her stock.

Nomfundo requested this loan through Women’s Development Businesses and Kiva to buy Tupperware. She says that the extra income from this loan will help her finish her house, which she has started to build.

In the future she would like to see herself having lots of clients and would like to drive a car to carry her Tupperware. She thanks WDB and Kiva for lending a loan to a poor woman like herself.

loans.use: To buy more Tupperware

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 36-year-old Lebanese single woman. She is living with her parents and three siblings. She participates in funerals and condolence visits. Her job consists in reading biographies of religious persons in addition to enlightening people and giving them advice to do good works.  She has a significant impact on people’s minds. She is recognized in this occupation as she gets invitations from abroad to be part of funerals to spread her inspiring messages. 

 Today, she is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a car in order to make her transportation effortless since she has lots of customers located in different areas asking for her services and she must fulfill their requests.

loans.use: to purchase a car as transport when working.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia R. C., de 54 años de edad, habita en casa propia con sus tres hijos, uno de los cuales se encuentra estudiando y los otros dos trabajan y ya empiezan a colaborar con los gastos de la casa. Lidia es una mujer trabajadora que durante mucho tiempo ha trabajado con mucha fuerza para sacar adelante a su familia. Se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en mercado mas grande de Mayoreo en El Salvador: La Tiendona, ubicado en el Municipio de San Salvador, capital del país y del Departamento del mismo nombre. Este negocio ha sido y sigue siendo su única fuente de ingresos por lo que desea seguir manteniéndolo activo, para poder brindar  el estudio a su  hijo y mejorar las condiciones de vida de toda su familia. Con una visión emprendedora como toda mujer ha decidido dar un paso más en el mundo de los negocios. Ha decidido solicitar este crédito a INTEGRAL para poder ampliar su negocio y poder tener acceso a mayor cantidad de frutas y verduras(Bananas, manzanas, piñas, rábanos, zanahorias, cebollas, remolachas y lechugas), para ofrecer a sus clientes que siempre le están demandando cada vez más,  ya que ella se preocupa por  mantener calidad, frescura y bue precio en los productos que ofrece. Con esto espera mejorar su calidad de vida y la de los suyos.
texts.en:
Lidia R. C., 54, lives in her own house with her three children.  One of them is in school and the other two work and have started to contribute to household expenses.  Lidia is a hard working woman who has worked very hard for a long time to support her family.  She sells fruit and vegetables in El Salvador’s largest wholesale market: La Tiendona, located in San Salvador, the nation’s capital, and in the Department of the same name.  This business has been and continues to be her only source of income so she wants to keep it operational to provide her son with schooling and improve the entire family’s living conditions.

With an enterprising vision like most women she has decided to take another step in the world of business and has decided to take out a loan with INTEGRAL to expand her business and have access to a greater variety of fruit and vegetables (bananas, apples, pineapples, radishes, carrots, onions, beets and lettuce) to offer her customers who always demand more each time since she always strives to have quality, freshness and good prices in the products she stocks.  She hopes this will lead to improved quality of life for herself and her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy bananas, apples, pineapples, carrots, onions, beets and lettuce.

loans.name: Ketevan

texts.en:
Ketevan is 46 years old. She lives in Kakheti, in the village of Patardzeuli. Ketevan is married and lives with her husband and 25-year-old son. Ketevan’s husband works as a driver and earns 500 Laris per month. Her son is unemployed at the moment. Ketevan earns 350 Laris per month, selling traditional Georgian cheese in Tbilisi. She has three milk cows, whose milk is used for the production of cheese. 

With the requested loan, Ketevan plans to purchase 4-5 calves and raise them. In 6-7 months she will sell the grown calves for a higher price. The profit will be reinvested in the same activity – more calves will be purchased for the next season. She hopes that after some time she’ll be able to put aside some savings for renovation of their house.

loans.use: to purchase calves.

loans.name: Ladysha

texts.en:
Ladysha J. B. is a lady of 24 years old, married to Zablon Kenik, and together they have one child. They live in Leltot where her farm is. She is a maize farmer; she sells her produce after harvest, and she has been doing so for one year now. 


This will be Ladysha's second loan from KADET LTD. She repaid the previous loan successfully, and she plans to use this entire loan to buy fertilizer for her farm. With the profit that she is going to get from selling the maize, she wants to invest in her retail shop. 


In future Ladysha wants to continue with farming, run her retail business, and also educate her child.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizers.

loans.name: Hilda Cristina

texts.es: Hilda Cristina V. D. J., D. 50 años D. edad, habita en casa propia con su compañero D. vida y su hijo que se encuentra estudiando. Hilda posee una tienda en la que ofrece diferentes productos como: papel desechable, frutas, bebidas, golosinas, galletas, café, entre otros D. primera necesidad. Además D. estos productos también venD. paletas refrigeradas y licuados que ella prepara D. fruta natural y fresca, todo esto en su casa D. habitación, ubicada en el Municipio D. Armenia del Departamento D. Sonsonate. Sueña con ampliar su negocio para poder dar a sus clientes una mayor variedad D. productos.
