En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada de esta ciudad. Se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

Aquí conocimos a Jennifer, tiene 20 años  de edad, es soltera, vive en casa de sus padres y estudia el quinto semestre de Psicología en la Universidad Técnica De Manabí. Este es el segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido sacar adelante su negocio y ayudarse para sus estudios.

Además de ser una muy buena estudiante ella también se dedica a  la elaboración  de articulos de fiesta como adornos y apliques hechos con fomix, a veces sus clientes también le piden juegos didácticos sobre todo para pequeñitos. Trabaja tres días a la semana y a veces hasta cuatro días cuando tiene mucho trabajo, nos cuenta que lleva dos años dedicada a esta actividad y que le ha ido muy bien.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en comprar fomix, pinturas, cartulinas, pegamentos y otros materiales útiles para elaborar sus obras.
 
Sus metas son ser profesional y sacar adelante a sus padres.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the Ilusiones community bank meet in El Progreso neighborhood, in the city of Portoviejo.  This is a very densely-populated, poor, urban area of the city.  It is known as 'the prison sector' because Portoviejo women's prison is located in this area.

Here we meet 20 year-old Jennifer who is single and lives in her parents' home.  She is studying her fifth semester of a psychology degree at Manabí Technical University.  This is her second loan cycle with her community bank and she likes it because, through the loans, she has managed to get ahead in her business and help herself in her studies.

As well as being a very good student, Jennifer also makes party supplies, such as decorations and appliqués, from Styrofoam.  Sometimes her customers also ask her for educational games for their little ones.  Jennifer works three days a week and sometimes four when she has a lot of work.  She tells us that she has been in this business for two years and it has done very well.  Jennifer will use her loan to buy Styrofoam, paint, card, glue and other materials she needs to make her products.

Jennifer's goals are to become a professional and to help her parents get ahead in life.

loans.use: to buy Styrofoam, paint, card, glue, etc.

loans.name: Vanessa Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad. Se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

Aquí conversamos con la señora Vanessa, ella tiene 27 años de edad, hace tres años su marido falleció y desde allí tuvo que hacerse cargo de todos los gastos de su familia y de sus tres hijos de 12, 11 y 8 años de edad, el mayor este año empieza el colegio y los menores están en escuela.

Ella es una gran madre que para sacar a sus hijos adelante se dedica a trabajar de lunes a viernes en una dulcería en el centro de la ciudad, los fines de semana se dedica a su propio negocio , el cual consiste en preparar y vender dulces para fiesta los mismos que entrega a los dueños de un centro de actos que realizan todo tipo de recepciones , se dedica a su negocio los sábados y domingos desde las 7h00 hasta las 17h00, este negocio le permite tener ingresos que le sirven para el sustento de su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar productos para la elaboración de los dulces. Este es su quinto ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha podido sacar adelante a su familia.
 
Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is one of the poorest in the city. It is also known as a prison area since the Women’s Prison of Portoviejo is located here.

Sra. Vanessa is being presented here. She is 27 years old and her husband died three years ago. Since then, she has had to bear all of the expenses of her family and those of her three children (ages 12, 11, and 8). The oldest child is in high school while the remaining children are in elementary school.

Vanessa is a good mother who wants to succeed on behalf of her children. She works Monday through Friday at a candy shop in the central part of the city. On the weekends, she has her own business in which she prepares and sells candies for parties. Vanessa delivers her goods to the owners of an events center that hosts all types of receptions. She operates her business Saturdays and Sundays from 7am to 5pm. This business enables her to have income to support her family.

This loan will be used to buy supplies for making candy. This is her fifth loan cycle with the Communal Bank and she enjoys the loans because they have helped her family move forward.

Her dreams are for her children to have a good education and to see them become good people.

loans.use: To purchase supplies for making candy.

loans.name: Hilda Esperanza

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad. Se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar conocimos a  la señora Hilda, Tiene 61 años de edad, es madre soltera de  cuatro  hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad,  con ella vive su hija que también es madre soltera de un bebé que es la alegría de nuestra amiga.
 
Tiene una tienda en su casa, allí además de víveres también vende artículos de bazar, medicinas y útiles escolares, labora todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 19h00, trabaja sola aunque a veces le ayuda su hija y nos cuenta que no le gusta tener muy tarde abierto por la inseguridad que hay por su localidad. Sus productos los compra en el centro de la ciudad y algunos los recibe en su local.  Lleva más de 20 años con su tienda y además de ser un medio para ganarse la vida también le sirve de entretenimiento.

Este crédito es para comprar útiles escolares que es lo que más  se vende en esta temporada. Este es su tercer ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los créditos.
 
Su sueño es que su negocio crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is one of the poorest in the city. It is also known as a prison area since the Women’s Prison of Portoviejo is located here.

Sra. Hilda is being presented here. She is 61 years old and a single mother of four adult children. Hilda lives with her daughter who is also a single mother. Her grandbaby gives her much joy.

Hilda has a store in her home where she sells provisions, bazaar items, medicines, and school supplies. She works every day from 6am to 9pm. Hilda works alone, but sometimes she has the help of her daughter. She says she does not like to stay open late because of the lack of safety in her community. Her products are purchased in the central part of the city and some of them are delivered to her store. She has been in business for more than 20 years. In addition to being a means of earning a living, her store also keeps her entertained.

This loan will be used to buy school supplies since these products sell the most during this season. This is her third loan cycle with the Communal Bank and she enjoys having credit. Her dream is to grow her business each day.

loans.use: To purchase school supplies.

loans.name: José Javier

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Javier le está haciendo falta colocar el vitropiso, pintar el interior y exterior de la casa. Pero en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar las mejorar esta necesitando para que su vivienda este en mejor condición para su familia. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo en una compañía de trasportes como chofer de un camión de carretera, ya que su esposa la señora Maria Estela con las ganancias que obtiene de su negocio de salón de belleza. 
Desean que sus hijos tengan una patrimonio seguro y en buenas condiciones.
texts.en:
The home of Sr. José Javier is lacking a tile floor as well as paint on the interior and exterior of his house. At the moment, he does not have the necessary funds to complete these improvements so that his home will be in the best condition for his family.

José Javier plans to repay the loan with the earnings he receives from his job at a transportation company where he works as a truck driver. His wife Sra. Maria Estela earns an income from her beauty salon business. They want their children to have a secure inheritance and good living conditions.

loans.use: To install a tile floor and complete the interior and exterior finishes of his house.

loans.name: Klever Neptalí

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad. Se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar encontramos a don Klever, tiene 55 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos, los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, todos viven aun en su casa. Su mujer es ama de casa.

El se dedica a la albañilería y realiza este crédito porque quiere hacer unas mejoras en su casa, va arreglar un baño que esta inhabilitado y les hace mucha falta porque su familia es muy grande y en las mañanas cuando tienen que ir a trabajar todos necesitan bañarse y vestirse, entonces para evitar estos inconvenientes necesita habilitar este otro baño.

Con este crédito va a comprar un juego de sanitarios, cemento, cerámicas, grifos de agua, ducha y otros materiales. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 ciclos y le gusta por la amistad que ha hecho con sus compañeras.
 
Sus sueños son tener una casa más grande y con más comodidades.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Ilusiones” (Illusions) meets every fifteen days in the neighborhood of El Progresso in the city of Portoviejo. This marginalized urban area is one of the poorest in the city. It is also known as a prison area since the Women’s Prison of Portoviejo is located here.

Don Klever is being presented here. He is 55 years old, in a common law marriage, and has four adult children. All of them live with him at his house. His wife is a homemaker.

Klever works as a mason and will use this loan to make a few improvements to his home. He will repair a bathroom that is not functioning. This bathroom needs to be in working order because his family is large and they need to bathe and get dressed in the mornings so that they can go to work. To avoid this problem, he needs to have the bathroom repaired.

This loan will be used to buy a set of toilets, cement, ceramic tiles, water faucets, a shower, and other materials. He has participated in the Communal Bank for four loan cycle and enjoys the friendships he has made with the other members. His dream is to have a larger and more comfortable house.

loans.use: To purchase toilets, cement, ceramic tiles, water faucets, a shower, and other materials.

loans.name: Aida Turqueza's Group

texts.en: Aida T. is from the village of Cabisera 17-21, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 29 years old. Aida is the group leader of a four-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. Aida is married and has an infant. To make a living, Aida runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Aida has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 3,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Aida joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Aida has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Aida is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase new items to expand her product offering. This will be the third loan taken out by Aida from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase new items to expand her product offering

loans.name: Mary Joy Beth

texts.en: Mary Joy Beth Q. is from the village of Tangaro, Catarman, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Mary Joy Beth is married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Mary Joy Beth runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and gasoline by the liter. Mary Joy Beth has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month from it. In 2010, Mary Joy Beth joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Joy Beth has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Mary Joy Beth is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Mary Joy Beth from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods and beverages

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en: Juliet P. is from the village of Lagunde, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 49 years old. Juliet is married and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Juliet runs a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, chocolate and milk powders, shampoo, soap and biscuits. Juliet has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2009, Juliet joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Juliet has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Juliet is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and beverages. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Juliet from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene, age 51, runs a sari-sari (general store) business. She has operated this business for seven years and also earns an income from water refilling. She and her husband have four children.

Arlene works hard to provide for her family. She has requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell in her store.

Arlene has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to build and expand her business so that she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Miriam

texts.en:
Miriam is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a sari-sari (general store) business. She has operated this business for two years and earns an additional income from phone e-loading. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more items to sell in her store. 

Miriam has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of her previous loans from NWTF. She aspires eventually to repair and renovate her home.

loans.use: to buy more items to offer for sale in her sari-sari store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, age 54, runs a rice retailing business. She has requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy more sacks of rice to offer for sale. She has been in this business for 15 years. She and her husband have five children, three of whom are still in school. Evelyn works very hard to provide for them.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save money so that she can expand her business and send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to offer for sale

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 57 years old and married with 11 children.

Melinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like sardines, groceries, etc., in her sari-sari store.

Melinda has borrowed and paid 22 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 30 years and also earns an income from selling charcoal.

Melinda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosebella

texts.en:
Rosebella Z. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 59 years old. Rosebella is separated from her spouse and has two adult children. To make a living, Rosebella owns and operates a service-based business. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from providing motorela or habal-habal services to local community members. Rosebella has been engaged in her business for more than two years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Rosebella joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosebella has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase tools needed to provide service. Rosebella is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase materials needed to expand services provided. This loan will be the second loan taken out by Rosebella from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase materials needed to expand services provided

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is 51 years old and separated, with 5 children.  She works hard to provide for her family.  She runs a sari-sari (variety) store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase soap, curls, groceries, etc., to sell in her sari-sari store.

Roselyn has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the sari-sari store for 2 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Roselyn aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell in her general store

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Jadambaa

texts.en: Jadambaa is 57 years old, and lives with his wife and two daughters in Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. They live together in a house that they built recently. His oldest daughter Oyunbileg, 32, graduated her university in Germany and works at Mongolian international airport as a foreign relations officer and his youngest daughter Anand, 18, attends a local secondary school. Jadambaa has worked at Mongolian Airlines as a storekeeper since 2002. He built a house by using his salary after he purchased his apartment. He is a very hardworking person who has good communication skills. He is requesting a loan to purchase constructiion materials to fix his house.

loans.use: to purchase construction material to fix his house

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda P. is from the village of Lagunde, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 44 years old. Melinda is widowed and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Melinda owns and operates a mini-restaurant. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from serving a variety of different meals like paklay and pork afritada to customers in the local community. Melinda has been engaged in her business for more than five years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Melinda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Melinda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and working capital. Melinda is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP which will be used to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. This loan will be the third loan taken out by Melinda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generate to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant

loans.name: Epifania

texts.en:
Epifania A. is from the village of Yumbing, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 46 years old. Epifania is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Epifania owns and operates a specialized retail store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling seafood products including dried fish and squid in the local community. Epifania has been engaged in her business for more than seven years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Epifania joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Epifania has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital. Epifania is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional dried fish and squids. This loan will be the fourth loan taken out by Epifania from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

loans.use: to purchase additional dried fish and squids

loans.name: Jeco

texts.en:
Jeco Z. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 22 years old. Jeco is single. To make a living, Jeco owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap & bread in the local community. Jeco has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately 6,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Jeco joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jeco is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Jeco from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods

loans.name: Shokirjon

texts.ru: Хамдамов Шокиржон проживает в районе Шахритус. Возраст, 44 года. Женат. Имеет 6 детей. Образование-среднее. Он занимается растениеводством. Он в основном выращивает овощи и арбуз по сезону. Этим видом деятельности занимается 8 лет. Кредит берет для закупа семян арбуза и минеральных удобрений.
texts.en: Shokirjon H. lives in the region of Shahrituz. He is 44 years old. He is married and has six children. He has secondary education. He is in agriculture and he mainly grows vegetables and watermelon during the season. He has been in this business for eight years. Shokirjon is asking for the loan to buy watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.use: to buy watermelon seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Anilyn

texts.en:
Anilyn S. is from the village of Balintawak, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 29 years old. Anilyn is single. To make a living, Anilyn owns & operates a specialized retail store buying and selling ready to wear clothing, pillows, underwear & shoe products in the local community. Anilyn has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 9000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Anilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Anilyn is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional products for sale like clothing, pillows, underwear and some shie products. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Anilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. To make a living, Yolanda owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling canned goods, junk food, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. loans.name: Burungu Karambi Womens Group

texts.en: Richard is a member of Burungu Karambi Women's Group where each member guarantees the others in accessing the loan. He is 54 years old and married with three children. He lives in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been operating a retail shop for a year, after diverting from the sale of fresh foods for over 10 years. He has the challenge of limited funds to meet the demands of his customers and his dream is to own a wholesale shop. Richard intends to use the loan to buy sugar, soap and salt for sell.

loans.use: To buy sugar, soap and salt to sell.

texts.en:
Pacita K. is from the village of Bugang, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 42 years old. Pacita is married and has seven school-aged children. To make a living, Pacita owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling beverages, canned goods, junk food, shampoo, soap & biscuits in the local community. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Pacita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Pacita is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase additional canned goods & beverages. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Pacita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business.

loans.name: Hayri

texts.ru: Негматова Хайри проживает в районе Вахдат. Ей 46 лет. Она вдова. У нее трое детей. Она имеет среднее образование. Рядом с домом открыла магазин. У нее магазин со смешанным ассортиментом. В этой области она 5 лет. Кредит берет для покупки ткани и посуды.
texts.en: Hayri N. lives in the Vahdat region. She is 46 years old. She is a widow and has three children. She has secondary education. She opened a store near her home. The store has mixed merchandise assortment. She has been in this business for five years. Hayri is taking out the loan to buy fabrics and dishes.

loans.use: to buy fabrics and dishes

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria tiene 26 años de edad y es casada. Vive en casa propia en una zona rural del distrito de Monsefú. Su vivienda cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua de pozo. Su distrito es conocido por sus festividades turísticas y religiosas. Las principales actividades que se realizan aquí son la producción de flores, la artesanía y la crianza de ganado vacuno. La zona está llena de vegetación y la comunidad es muy pequeña. Se encuentra ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Maria gana la vida con la elaboración y venta de sombreros de paja. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 2 años. Es muy conocida en este rubro y tiene una clientela ya establecida. Vende sus productos a pedido a sus vecinos y amistades y también al público general en los mercados locales. Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Desea hacerle unos arreglos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).
texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old and married. She lives in her own home in the rural section of the District of Monsefú. Her home receives electricity and well water. This district is known for its tourist and religious festivals. The main business activities here are flower production, handicrafts, and cattle breeding. Despite being a small community, this area is full of vegetation. The community is located 20 minutes away from the city of Chiclayo.

Maria earns her living by manufacturing and selling straw hats. She has been in this business for two years. Maria is well-known in this trade and already has an established customer base. She sells her products according to orders from her neighbors and friends, as well as directly to the general public at the local markets.

At the moment, her house is in a state of deterioration so she needs to make a few repairs. For this reason, Maria is requesting a loan of 1500 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa (a Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: To pay for home repairs.

loans.name: Maria Emperatriz

texts.es: Maria tiene 36 años D. edad. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus dos menores hijos. ResiD. en el distrito D. Cayaltí, en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Se encuentra ubicada a más D. una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque. Maria gana la vida brindando el servicio D. tipeado e internet. Tiene más D. 10 años D. experiencia en el negocio. Solicita un préstamo para comprar insumos como papel, toner, tinta etc para su negocio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Es muy conocida en la zona por tener buenas referencias personales. Agradece a los prestamistas D. Kiva por su ayuda en el mantenimiento D. su negocio.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old and lives in her own home with her husband and two young children. They resiD. in the District of Cayaltí, a community that is dedicated to traD., agriculture, and livestock breeding. This area is located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Maria earns her living by providing typing and Internet services. She has more than ten years of experience in this business. Maria needs to buy more supplies such as paper, toner, ink, and other items for her business. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 2000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa.

Maria is well-known in her area and has good personal references. She is grateful to the Kiva lenders for their assistance in maintaining her business.

loans.use: To purchase paper, toner, ink, and other supplies.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine B. is from Mercy Village, Cabuan, Guinsiliban, Camiguin Province. She is 36 years old. Josephine is single and has one school-aged children. To make a living, Josephine owns & operates a business making and selling snacks & other delicacies like cassava cakes & fruit cocktails in the local community. Josephine has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Josephine joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Josephine is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP to purchase raw ingredients needed like cassava, sugar & flour. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Josephine from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients like cassava, sugar & flour

loans.name: Elvis Helio

texts.es: Elvis  tiene 22 años de edad. Es soltero y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres en la parte rural del distrito de Tucume en Lambayeque, Perú. Gana la vida criando y vendiendo animales en un pequeño terreno cerca de su domicilio. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Ya cuenta con una clientela establecida. Tiene 2 años de experiencia en este rubro. Desea usar su crédito será para la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. También, pretende hacer unos arreglos a sus corrales para mejor proteger sus animales del sol. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1200 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).
texts.en:
Elvis is 22 years old, single, and has no children. He lives in the home of his parents in the rural section of the District of Tucume in Lambayeque, Peru.  Elvis earns his living by raising and selling animals from a small piece of land near his home.  When the animals have reached a good size and weight, he offers them for sale to traders who frequently visit the area.  Elvis already has an established customer base and has worked in this type of business for two years.  

He wants to acquire more animals and balanced feed.  In addition, he needs to make a few repairs to the animal pens so that he can better protect his livestock from the sun.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan of 1200 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa (a Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: To repair his animal pens as well as purchase balanced feed and more livestock.

loans.name: Gladis

texts.es: Gladis tiene 49 años. Vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en el distrito de Paiján, perteneciente a la Provincia de Ascope ubicado en la región de la Libertad, que está a más de tres horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y productos natura para la salud. Vende por catálogo sus productos a sus vecinos y sus amistades en su caserío y sus alrededores. Tiene aproximadamente 5 años de experiencia en este negocio. Cuenta con una clientela fiel. Tiene buenas referencias por parte de sus vecinos y conocidos que dicen que es una persona trabajadora y responsable. Solicita un préstamo para invertir en su negocio con la compra de más productos como maquillaje, perfumes y humectantes por su nueva campaña y también para entregar pedidos de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gladis is 49 years old and lives with her husband and three children in the District of Paiján, which is part of Ascope Province in La Libertad region. This community is more than three hours away from the city of Chiclayo.

Gladis sells beauty products and natural health products. She sells her merchandise through catalogs to her neighbors and friends who live in her village and in the surrounding areas. Gladis has approximately five years of experience in this business. She has a loyal customer base.

Gladis has good references from her neighbors and acquaintances who state that she is a hardworking and responsible person. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business by acquire more products such as makeup, perfumes, and moisturizers for her new sales campaign so that she can fulfill the orders of her customers.

loans.use: To purchase makeup, perfumes, and moisturizers.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma B. is from the village of Bugang, Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 43 years old. Gemma is single and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Gemma owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, choco & milk powder, shampoo, soap & beverages in the local community. Gemma has been engaged in her business for over seven years and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Gemma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma is requesting a new loan of 4,000 PHP to purchase additional beverages & biscuits. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Gemma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional beverages & biscuits

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel tiene 26  años y es soltera. Vive en casa propia y tiene 03 hijos menores. Reside en el caserío Tranca Fanupe, ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope en el norte de Perú. Maribel gana la vida alquilando su mototaxi, la cual le reporta una ganancia diaria. Alquila su mototaxi a conductores en su caserío y zonas aledañas. Maribel también posee una bodega que funciona en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brinda. Adicionalmente se dedica a la venta de aves de corral como pavos, patos y gallinas. Gracias a estas actividades ella ha podido mantener a su familia y sacarla adelante. Solicita un crédito para ayudar con el mantenimiento de su mototaxi. También desea comprar más abarrotes para su bodega. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Maribel ha manejado préstamos en el pasado y pagó sus cuotas de manera puntual.
texts.en:
Maribel is 26 years old and single. She lives in her own home with her three young children in the village of Tranca Fanupe, which is 20 minutes away from the city of Mórrope in northern Peru.

Maribel earns her living by renting out a motorcycle taxi that generates a daily income. The vehicle is rented out to drivers in her village and in the surrounding areas. Maribel also has a store that she manages from her home. There she offers her neighbors and local customers different everyday consumer products as well as good service. In addition, she raises poultry such as turkeys, ducks, and hens. Thanks to these business activities she is able to support her family and move them forward.

Maribel is requesting a loan to help with maintaining her motorcycle taxi. She also wants to buy more groceries for her store. For this reason, she is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa. Maribel has handled loans in the past and submitted her payments on time.

loans.use: To repair her motorcycle taxi and acquire more merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Manuel Salvador

texts.es: Manuel tiene 65 años de edad. Vive junto a su esposa e hijo en casa propia en el distrito de San José. Esta ciudad está ubicada en la provincia de Pacasmayo, una zona con bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra ubicada en la región La Libertad, a más de dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Manuel gana la vida criando y vendiendo animales menores. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen punto desarrollo, los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Lleva más de tres años realizando esta actividad en su domicilio. Su esposa lo ayuda en su negocio. Desea comprar más animales menores y alimento balanceado con la finalidad de generar más ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).
texts.en: Manuel is 65 years old. He lives with his wife and son in their own home in the district of San José. This city is located in the province of Pacasmayo, uan area with a lot of comercial activty located in the La Libertad region, more than two hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital Lambayeque region. Manuel makes his living raising and selling small animals. When his animals have reached a good point of development, he offers them for sale to dealers who visit the area. He has been doing this activity for more than three years, from his house. His wife helps him with the business. He wants to buy more small animals and balanced feed in order to generate more income and improve his family's quality of life. For this, he decided to ask for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to buy more animals and balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: Jackson

texts.en:
Jackson K. K. is 49 years old, married and the father of five children. He lives with his family in Mosop, Eldoret. His wife Elizabeth keeps poultry for sale. Jackson is a maize farmer. He has been farming for 11 years now and gets a monthly income of 9,000 shillings.

With this loan Jackson plans to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer for his farm. He wants to use the income that he will get from selling the maize to pay school fees for his children. 

In the future Jackson wants to buy a tractor that will help him with ploughing, and educate his children further.

loans.use: to buy maize seeds and fertilizer.

loans.name: Madilyn

texts.en:
Madilyn B. is from the village of Bugang in Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 58 years old. Madilyn is widowed and has 11 school-aged children. To make a living, Madilyn buys and raises pigs for sale. Madilyn has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately 3,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month for these activities.

In 2011, Madilyn joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Madilyn is requesting a loan of 4,000 PHP which will be used to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Madilyn from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase baby livestock to raise and sell.

loans.name: Jose Ricardo

texts.es: José tiene 56 años de edad y es soltero sin hijos. Vive en casa de familia junto a sus padres ancianos en el distrito de Reque, una zona ubicada a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo en el norte de Perú. Reside en la parte rural de su distrito y tiene los servicios básicos de agua y luz. José gana la vida prestando servicios de internet dentro de su vivienda. Cuenta con 04 máquinas. Esta actividad le permite sobrevivir  y cuidar a sus padres ancianos. Hace más de 3 años que tiene su negocio. El destino del crédito será para la adquisición de mercadería como golosinas y gaseosas para ser ofrecidos dentro de su negocio a sus usuarios. Eso le permitirá obtener otros ingresos para su subsistencia. Para lograr esta meta, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).
texts.en: José is 56 years old and single with no children. He lives in his family home with his elderly parents in the district of Reque, an area located twenty minutes from the city of  Chiclayo in the north of Perú. He lives in the rural part of his district and he has the basic services such as running water and electricity. José makes his living offering internet service in his home. He has 4 computers. This activity allows him to survive and take care of his elderly parents. He has had this business for more than 3 years. The loan will be used to acquire merchandise such as candies and soft drinks to offer to users of his business. This will allow him to obtain more income for his subsistence. To acheive this goal, he has decided to ask for a loan of 500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as candies and soft drinks to sell in his internet cafe.

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz C. is from the village of Bugang in Sagay, Camiguin Province. She is 41 years old. Luz is widowed and has eight school-aged children. To make a living, Luz runs a sari-sari (general goods) shop, selling canned goods, snacks, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits. Luz has been engaged in her business for over six years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Luz is requesting a new loan of 4,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase additional stock. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional goods to sell.

loans.name: Andres

texts.es: Andres tiene 37 años de edad, es casado y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia junto a su familia en la zona rural del distrito de Lambayeque. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 50  familias. Gana la vida brindando el servicio de entretenimiento, contando con equipo de sonido propio. El ameniza las principales fiestas de su caserío. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 3 años. Su negocio está situado en su domicilio. Aprendió esta actividad de su tío, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Con los ingresos provenientes de su negocio de entretenimiento, abrió una bodega donde vende abarrotes y productos de primera necesidad. Este negocio  cuenta con competencia  pero también cuenta con un amplio mercado para su comercialización. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de más abarrotes para su tienda. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternative (Kiva Field Partner). Andres es un cliente antiguo de Edpyme Alternativa y tiene un buen record de pagos.
texts.en: Andres is 37 years old, married, and he has one son. He lives in a house that he owns together with his family in the rural region of the Lambayeque district. His community is small, consisting of approximately 50 families. He earns a living through an entertainment business. He has his own sound system. He caters to the major parties in his community. He has had this business for three years. He runs his business from his house. He learned the business from his uncle, which is to say that he is an expert in the field. With the income from his entertainment business, he was able to open a convenience store where he sells groceries and basic needs products. This business is very competitive but that is because he has a large market to cater to. The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of grocery items for his store. For this reason he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in 2000 nuevos soles. Andres is a long time client with Edpyme Alternativa and he has a good payment history.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries for his convenience store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy feed and medicine for her poultry.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa O. is from the village of Bolok-bolok, Mambajao, Camiguin Province.  She is 43 years old.  Jesusa is single.  To make a living, Jesusa owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, candies and biscuits in the local community.  Jesusa has been engaged in her business for over 6 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Jesusa joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jesusa has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI.  This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  Jesusa is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional candies, junk foods and breads.  This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Jesusa from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional candies, junk foods and breads

loans.name: Pedro Ruperto

texts.es: Pedro tiene 37  años de edad y es soltero. Vive en casa familiar en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.  Pedro gana la vida brindando el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi, un vehículo que consta de una moto y una cabina para movilizar personas en su interior. Tiene varios años de experiencia en el rubro y cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. Desea usar el préstamo para el mantenimiento y reparación de su mototaxi. Necesita mantener su vehículo en buenas condiciones para seguir ofreciendo un buen servicio a sus clientes. Con la ayuda de un préstamo, espera aumentar sus ingresos para poder comprar otro taxi que puede alquilar y con el cual puede generar más ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Pedro is 37 years old and he is single. He lives in the family home in the district of Motupe, an agricultural region belonging to the province of Lambayeque. it is located an hour and a half  from the city of Chiclayo. Pedro earns a living by providing passenger transport services with his motorcycle rickshaw. It is a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle and a cabin to transport passengers inside. He has many years' experience in the field and he has very good personal and work-related references. He wants to use this loan to carry out maintenance and repairs to his motorcycle rickshaw. He needs to keep his vehicle in good condition in order to keep offering a good level of service to his clients. With the help of this loan he expects to increase his income. He will be able to purchase another taxi to rent out and to generate another source of income. For this reason he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1200 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to carry out maintenance and repairs to his rickshaw

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 51-year-old Lebanese married man living with his wife and three young children who are still attending school. He has more than 30 years of experience working with home appliances. In 1984, he launched his own business where he began dealing in air conditioners. He purchases his products from a local electric center. 

His work consists in selling both used and new AC units in addition to repairing damaged ones.  His wife has been working as a teacher in a local school for 18 years to provide extra financial support for the family. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy more products. He is planning to strengthen his commercial operation to end up with increased sales and higher income.

loans.use: to buy more products.

loans.name: Nancy Judith

texts.es: Nancy tiene 26  años de edad y es soltera. Vive en casa de padres  con su hija pequeña. Reside en una zona urbana en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz cerca de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el norte de Perú. Su comunidad es pequeña y está en vías de crecimiento. Se dedica a la venta de comida como hamburguesas, anticuchos, brochetas y pancitas. Ejerce esta actividad por las noches desde hace más de 2 años. Su punto de venta es en su vivienda. Con su préstamo, Nancy comprará otro carrito sanguchero, una especie de carreta que viene equipada con todas las herramientas para cocinar su comida. Esto la ayudará a ampliar su negocio y por consiguiente mejorará sus ingresos. Su mayor anhelo para su negocio es un día construir un restaurante donde venda todo tipo de comida. Nancy goza de muy buenas referencias personales y laborales manifestadas por vecinos y amigos.
texts.en: Nancy is 26 years old and she is single. She lives at home with her parents and her little girl.  She lives in an urban region of the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, near the city of Chiclayo in the northern part of Peru. Her community is small but it is starting to develop. She sells prepared foods such as hamburgers, kebabs, brochettes, and stew. For the past two years she has opened for business in the evenings. She makes her sales from her house. With her loan, Nancy will purchase a sandwich cart, a type of food stand that is equipped with all kinds of cooking tools to prepare her foods. This will help her expand her business, and in turn, this will increase her income. Her greatest dream is to build a restaurant one day from where she would sell all types of foods. Nancy has many good personal and work-related references set forth by neighbors and friends.

loans.use: to purchase a food cart to prepare foods that she sells

loans.name: Sardaran's Group

texts.en:
Sardaran lives in Jaranwala which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture industry. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house in the area of Rasheed Park with her family for the past 8 years. She is married to M. H. who is 60 years old and doesn’t work. Sardaran is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. 

Sardaran has given birth to two sons and a daughter. She couldn’t provide education to her sons due to poor financial conditions. Her eldest son operates a grocery store while the 2nd one works in a factory. Her daughter studies in class 8. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her eldest son son who wants to buy groceries for the expansion of his grocery store. The bulk grocery stock will help him sell a greater quantity to his customers and earn better income. Sardaran is hopeful that through the loan investment her son will be able to make better profits from his business and become established in it. 

 She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In previous loan years, she has established a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sardaran.

loans.use: To buy groceries for grocery store business.

loans.name: Nova

texts.en:
Nova L. is from the village of St. Joseph Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province.  She is 34 years old.  Nova is married and has 3 school-aged children.  To make a living, Nova owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from buying and selling canned goods, junk foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and candies in the local community.  Nova has been engaged in her business for over 7 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Nova joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Nova has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI.  This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and working capital.  Nova is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and junk food.  This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Nova from HSPFI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and junk food

location.town: St. Joseph Village, Mambajao, Camiguin Province

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José tiene 20 años de edad y es soltero. Vive en el distrito de La Victoria, una zona rural en la provincia de Chiclayo en el norte de Perú. Cuenta con energía eléctrica pero no agua potable. Consume el agua de un pozo. Se dedica a la agricultura. Esta actividad lo realiza en un terreno de sus padres. Actualmente, tiene sembrado cebolla de rabo. Adicionalmente, José genera ingresos adicionales prestando su servicio de faenas agrícolas. Solicita un crédito para invertir en su cultivo de cebolla ya que necesita comprar abonos e insecticidas. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternative (Kiva Field Partner) un crédito de 600 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Jose is 20 years old and he is single. He lives in the district of La Victoria, an rural region in the province of Chiclayo in Peru's north. He has hydro but he does not have potable water. He uses water from a well. He is an agriculturist. He carries out his work on his parents' fields.  Currently he has a plantation of green onions. Additionally, Jose also generates a supplementary income by providing agricultural services. He requests a loan to invest on his onion plantation, needing to purchase fertilizers and pesticides. For this reason he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 600 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for his onion plantation

loans.name: Pavel

texts.en:
Pavel A. was born in 1960. He lives in Achajur village in Ijevan. Pavel is married and has a son and daughter. His daughter is married and lives separately. 

Pavel and his wife work as teachers. With the help of their son they also raise cows, keep bees and grow maize, wheat and grapes. 

With the income from farming Pavel meets most of his family’s needs. It helped pay for his children’s education and his daughter’s wedding as well as repairs on and furniture for his house.
 
Pavel is asking for an 800,000 Armenian Drams (AMD) loan to buy some calves and beehives, and also maize seed to sow on his plot of land. 

He intends to use his future income to buy pigs, sow wheat and cultivate more vines.

loans.use: To buy calves, beehives and maize seed.

loans.name: Rwemengo Tumanyane Group, Ibanda

texts.en:
K. Prosper is the leader of Rwemengo Tumanyane group in Ibanda. He is 53 years old and married with seven children, out of whom four are in school. Prosper has a grocery store plus being in charge of selling produce, which includes selling coffee, beans and bananas, and he is able to make over $22 in weekly profits. His store is in the Rwemengo trading center.

Fourteen years ago he started his business after selling a cow.  He is very hard working and social and he says that working with his wife has enabled him to succeed. He is also involved in the sale of milk from his cows and this supplements his income. He needs a loan to be able to purchase produce for the store.

loans.use: to purchase produce for the store

loans.name: Nissel

texts.en:
Nissel M. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. She is 27 years old. Nissel is single and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, she owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Nissel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be her 1st loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Maria Fanny

texts.es: María tiene 30 años y es casada. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y 3 hijos en el caserío Casablanca, ubicado a 15 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope en el norte de Perú. Se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en una bodega instalada en su propio domicilio. Allí vende una variedad de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. Vende sus productos al contado y al crédito. Es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con clientela fidelizada. También se dedica a la crianza de aves de corral como patos, pavos y gallinas en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella vende quincenalmente los animales que han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso. Solicita un crédito para la compra de más abarrotes para surtir su bodega y alimento para sus animales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar su segundo préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). María solicitó su primer crédito de Edpyme Alternativa y demostró responsabilidad en sus pagos.
texts.en: Maria is 30 years old and she is married. She lives in a house that she owns together with her husband and their three children in the community of Casablanca. It is located 15 minutes from the city of Morrope in Peru's north. She sells groceries from a convenience store installed in her home. She sells a variety of basic needs products and grocery items. She completes her sales in cash and credit. She is very well known in the area and she has a loyal client base. She also raises foul, such as ducks, turkeys, and poultry in the rear part of her house. She sells the livestock bi-weekly when they have reached a good size and weight. She requests a loan to purchase more groceries to stock her convenience store and to buy feed for her livestock. For this reason, Maria has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) and she demonstrated responsibility with her payments on her first loan.

loans.use: to supply her convenience store with groceries and to purchase balanced feed for her livestock

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es: José tiene 19 años de edad. Vive en casa familiar junto con sus tíos en el caserío el Medano afuera del distrito de Olmos. Éste es una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Vive en la  parte rural del distrito y no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz. Se dedica a la crianza y comercio de animales menores como ganado ovino y caprino. Recorre su caserío y anexos comprando ganado para engorde y su posterior venta. El destino del crédito será para la compra de más ganado para aumentar su negocio y sus ventas. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles.
texts.en: Jose is 19 years old. He lives sin the family home together with his uncles in the community of El Medano outside of the district of Olmos. It is an agricultural region with significant commercial movement and it is located in the province of Lambayeque, at more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He lives in the rural section of the district and he does not have hydro and water services. He raises and sells small livestock such as goats and sheep. He travels through the community and neighboring areas purchasing livestock to raise and resell.  The loan will be used to purchase more livestock to increase his business and his sales. For this reason he has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 800 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase more livestock to raise and resell

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 26 years old, married and has one child.

Haydar is a carpenter; in 2002 he opened his own shop selling furniture. He has 8 years of experience in this field and has a good reputation and he is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $3000 loan to buy new equipment and to increase procurement. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality life.

loans.use: To buy new equipment and to increase procurement.

loans.name: Rodel

texts.en:
Rodel C. is from the village of Kuguita, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 41 years old. Rodel is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, he owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits in the local community. He has been engaged in his business for over two years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Rodel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Susana

texts.es: Susana tiene 57 años de edad, es casada y tiene hijos adultos. Vive junto a su esposo y una hija en el distrito de Pacanga ubicado en la provincia de Chepen, una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, en el norte de Perú. Esta zona es conocida por gente humilde que se dedica al comercio y la agricultura. Susana se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, verduras y tuberculos. Tiene más de 30 años de experiencia en este rubro. Vende sus productos en el mercado Pacauguilla.  Desea usar su préstamo para ampliar su mercadería con la compra de más abarrotes (arroz, azúcar, aceite) y verduras. Ha manejado otro préstamo de Edpyme Alternativa y lo canceló de manera puntual.
texts.en: Susana is 57 years old, married, and her children are adults. He lives together with her husband and one of her daughters in the district of Pacanga, located in the province of Chepen. It is one hour from the city of Chiclayo, in Peru's north. The region is known for its humble population that is dedicated to commerce and agriculture. Susana sells groceries, vegetables, and tubers. She has more than 30 years' experience in the field. She sells her products in the Pacauguilla market. She wants to use her loan to supplement her inventory with the purchase of more grocery items (rice, sugar, cooking oil) and vegetables. She has had a previous loan with Edpyme Alternativa and she completed her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items such as rice, sugar, cooking oil and vegetables

loans.name: Alexander

texts.en:
Alexander V. is from the village of Pandan, Mambajao, Camiguin Province. He is 27 years old. Alexander is married and has two infant-aged children. To make a living, he provides motorela or habal-habal services (motorcycle transportation) to local community members. He has been engaged in his business for over five years and earns approximately $150 a month for these activities.

In 2011, Alexander joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase tools and supplies needed to provide his service. This will be his 1st loan from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase tools and supplies needed to provide his service

loans.name: Sara

texts.es: Sara tiene 31  años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa propia en el caserío Lagunas ubicado a 25  minutos  de la ciudad de Morrope en el norte de Perú. Su comunidad es rural y pequeña con un aproximado de 300  familias. Se gana la vida desde hace 10  años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. El suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos. Cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuenta con ingresos adicionales de la preparación y venta de chicha, una bebida típica de Perú hecha de harina de maíz. Sara desea invertir en la compra de aves menores para engorde y alimento balanceado para sus animales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner).
texts.en: Sara is 31 years old, single, and she does not have children. She lives in a house that she owns in the community of Lagunas, located at 25 minutes from the city of Morrope in Peru's north. Her community is a small rural community consisting of approximately 300 families. She has earned a living for the past 10 years by raising and selling small livestock from the rear section of her house. She raises pigs, sheep, turkeys, and ducks. When they have reached a good level of development she sells them to the merchants who always visit the region where she lives. She learned this business from her parents, that is to say that she is an expert in the field. She has an additional source of income by preparing and selling chicha, a traditional drink in Peru made of corn flour. She wants to invest her loan in the purchase of small livestock to raise and to purchase balanced feed for them. For this reason she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan in the amount of 1500 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to purchase small livestock and livestock feed

loans.name: Rafiqan's Group

texts.en:
Rafiqan is the wife of K. M. and lives in a small city called Jaranwala in Pakistan. Jaranwala is a city known for its agriculture industry. 

A caring lady, Rafiqan stays at home and carries out her responsibilities as a housewife. Besides her household work, she also helps her husband in his dairy business. They both get up early in the morning, get milk from the buffalo, and then her husband goes to the community to sell the milk.  In this way, they both generate the income to meet the basic needs of the family.

Rafiqan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s dairy business. Through the loan, he will buy another buffalo that will help him increase milk productivity and also sales.  

Rafiqan is hopeful that through the loan investment, her husband’s business will improve and he will be able to increase his monthly income as well. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rafiqan.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo for their dairy business.

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en:
Sari Mertha group is located in Dusun Tegal Sari, Sumberkima Village, Singaraja. This group has a total membership of 10 people, and all the members of the group are women who are married and have children. This group has loans of  Rp. 10,000,000, and the person who responsible for the group is Ni Luh P.. Ni Luh P. is the Sari Mertha leader. She has good experience in managing the business of pigs, but because her capital is only slight, her business did not develop and produced only a small profit. Therefore she chose to borrow capital at MUK. 

Ni Luh P. will get a loan of Rp. 1,000,000 to be used to buy superior piglets and also to buy their feed. With this loan, she hopes this effort will go forward and succeed so as to improve the economy of her family.

loans.use: To buy superior piglets.

loans.name: Abdel Karim

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 51 years old, single, and lives with 2 brothers.

Abdel Karim has owned a shop selling motor oil since 2009. He has more than 10 years' experience in this field. He is well known and has a good reputation in his local community.

He is requesting a $2700 loan to paint the walls of his shop and renovate it and to increase sales. So he wants to develop his business and to offer the best services for clients and to grow bigger.
