location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Youness

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 22 years old, single and lives with six family members. Three of the family members work.

In 2007, Youness opened an auto repair shop. He has five years experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $2,400 loan to buy a testing machine and a nozzle-cleaning machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a testing machine and a nozzle-cleaning machine.

loans.name: Haydar

texts.en:
This borrower is from Iraq. He is 32 years old and married. He has one child and lives with seven family members. Two of the family members work.

Haydar is a blacksmith; in 2006, he opened an auto repair shop. He has seven years experience in this field, a good reputation and is well known in his area.

He is requesting a $1,200 loan to buy a new hydraulic machine. He is aiming to gain more profits so he can improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: To buy a new hydraulic machine

loans.name: Nodar

texts.en:
Nodar M. is 60 years old and lives with his wife in the village of Martkopi, Gardabani district. The family has four milk cows and sells milk locally. Along with agriculture, Nodar has a tanker (truck) and works as a contractor for a local private company – he performs transportation of gasoline with his tanker. 

With the requested credit, Nodar plans to renovate his tanker in such a way that he will be able to transport two types of fuel (gasoline and diesel) simultaneously, i.e., split the cistern into two parts. That will allow him to take more orders from other companies and individuals as well and will significantly increase his income. 

He plans to put aside some savings to use for further development of the family's dairy farm.

loans.use: to pay for renovation of his tanker.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials for her fish-selling stall, purchase timber, iron sheets and pay labor.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham K. C. is a young man of twenty-six, married to Viola Maiyo and they have one child who is two-and-a-half years old. They live in Waunifor on the outskirts of Eldoret. Abraham is a maize farmer in the same area and his wife also helps with the farm work. He sells the maize after harvest and gets a monthly income of nine thousand shillings. He has been in this business for five years now.


This will be Abraham's second loan with KADET LTD. He repaid the previous loan successfully. He plans to buy maize seedlings and fertilizer for the farm. With the income that he will get, he plans to plough money back into the farm. 


In future he wants to buy a bigger plot of land, maybe two acres, and continue with maize farming, and also save some money and educate his child.

loans.use: To buy maize seedlings  and fertilizer.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a married lady with two children.  She has been in the business of selling green maize for thirteen years.  She has employed two people to assist her in the business.  She was previously selling milk so as to earn a living.  

Through Faulu Kenya she has improved her business hence improving her living standards.  Mary has a lorry which she uses for transport.  She requested 80,000 Kes to buy another lorry.

loans.use: To buy a second lorry.

loans.name: Yucabeth

texts.en:
Yucabeth is a married woman with three children, two of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. She has operated a bookshop business for the past three years, selling to her neighbours and passersby.

Yucabeth faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During holiday season the demand for products is lower compared to school-going season. She dreams of establishing two more branches in the future.

With the Kshs 30,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase stationery, books, pens and pencils. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase stationery, books, pens and pencils.

loans.name: Thiaba

texts.fr: Madame Thiaba N. est une femme mariée de 55 ans. Elle vit dans la localité de Yoff depuis plusieurs années. Elle est mère de 4 enfants dont l’âge varie entre 18 et 27 ans. Elle travaille comme femme de charge à l’hôpital  SAMU depuis 1986. Avant de rejoindre le secteur de la santé elle était employée  à l’aéroport comme technicienne de surface. Au terme de son contrat à l’hôpital elle a porté son choix sur la profession de  femme de charge car elle trouve beaucoup de plaisir à aider les malades. Elle est sociétaire au guichet de Yoff depuis aout 2001. Elle a déjà remboursé 8 prêts  antérieurs. Elle sollicite un crédit de 500 000 frs. Ce financement lui permettra de réaménager sa maison (construction d’un appartement). Son but est d’améliorer les conditions  sociales de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Mrs. Thiaba N. is a 55-year-old married woman.  She has lived in the town of Yoff for several years, and has four children between the ages of 18 and 27.  She has worked as a housekeeper at the SAMU hospital since 1986.  Before entering the health sector, she worked as a cleaner at the airport.  At the end of her contract she chose hospital housekeeping because she takes great pleasure in helping the sick.  She has been a member of the Yoff bank since August 2001 and has already paid back eight previous loans.  She is requesting a loan of 500,000 Francs.  This will allow her to convert her house, constructing an apartment.  Her goal is to improve the social living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to build an apartment

loans.name: Jennifer

texts.en:
Jennifer is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school while the other one is still too young for school. They live in a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills, and transport costs.

For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop business, selling to her neighbours and passersby. Jennifer faces a major challenge of competition from other retail shop operators. She dreams of managing a well-equipped retail shop in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000 she wants to purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, mineral water and soft drinks for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her living standards.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of maize flour, wheat flour, cooking oil, mineral water and soft drinks for resale.

loans.name: Sadiq

texts.en: Sadiq N. is married, has three children, and makes a living as a businessman in Agsu, Azerbaijan, selling auto accessories and spare parts in a local car market. His business, which is five years old, is flourishing, as more and more people buy vehicles, and the items he sells are always in high demand. To take advantage of this demand, he is applying for a loan for 1000 AZN to buy more items to sell to his customers. His goals are to maintain his leading position in the market and continue to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase more items to increase profit.

loans.name: Ilham

texts.en: Ilham N., a 54-year-old married father of four children, has been selling household goods such as kettles, pails, basins and many other items for the past seven years in order to support his family. The business is quite successful, carrying goods that meet client demand, thereby generating a stable income that allows Ilham to improve the living conditions of his family and make his children happy. A successful client with one previous loan, he is now requesting 1400 AZN to enlarge the range of goods he carries. Ilham promises to repay on time.

loans.use: to purchase more goods.

loans.name: Salifu S.'s Group

texts.en:
These are staff members of the DEC Dogoloya Primary School situated seven miles from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1968 by the District Council to promote education in the Chiefdom. DEC Dogoloya is staffed with 10 teachers and has an enrollment of 665 pupils. 

Salifu S. S. is the leader of this group of teachers. The 47-year-old Salifu was born in a town call Falaba, near Kabala. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has four children who are attending primary school. Salifu has been a teacher for 23 years now, and with his share of this loan, he is going to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James A. is 33 years old and married with two children. For the past five years he has operated a grocery store where he has employed three people. James also owns his own business premises. He has used his previous loans from Faulu Kenya to boost his business.

James has requested 40,000 KES to buy tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and cereals. He hopes to add a butchery in the future.

loans.use: To buy tomatoes, potatoes, vegetables and cereals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase additional foodstuffs

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary B. is married and has three children, none of whom is in school. She also takes care of her mother. Mary lives in the Nakulabye neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She has a retail pharmacy. She has been in this business for over ten years, and she works seven days a week.

Mary lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include rent for her drug shop, food and taxes. The main business challenges for Mary include thieves, defaulters and the rainy season.

Mary has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of pharmaceuticals and syringes. Her goal for her business is to own a fully-stocked pharmacy.

loans.use: To buy more boxes of drugs and syringes

loans.name: Vasif

texts.en:
Vasif B. is 43 years old, married and has two children. For the past six years, he has been a welder. Depending on the season, Vasif has different orders. In cold seasons it is stoves, and in hot seasons, gates and iron barriers. He sells them at the market.

Vasif has applied for a loan of 1,000 AZN to purchase the necessary materials to make his orders. With your help, he will be able to make his business succeed and provide his children with necessities.

loans.use: To purchase materials to make his stoves, gates and iron barriers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more inventory for her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to expand grocery store inventory

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: purchase more items to increase his stock.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a 34-year-old married man.  He has two school-going children, aged 3 and 10.  He has been operating a tailoring business for five years.  He also works as an auctioneer.  He was previously practicing pig farming to earn a living.  Being a member of Faulu Kenya, he opened a savings account.   This has helped him to manage his finances.  He has requested 40,000 Kes to add to his stock of fabrics.

loans.use: To add to his stock of fabrics.

loans.name: Tereza

texts.en:
Tereza M. lives in the Kyebando neighbourhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda.  She is married and has six children, three of whom are in school.   Tereza has a poultry farm.  She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works all but one day out of every week. Tereza sells her products from home. She has requested a loan of 1,000,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of chicken feed.   She also generates additional income through rental rooms.

The main business challenges for Tereza include seasonality and poultry diseases.  Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own 2000 chickens.   Tereza lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more bags of chicken feed.

loans.name: Murivatsho

texts.en:
A. Murivatsho is married and has four children. His wife is a teacher. Murivatsho is a hard-working man who sells household products in the market of Ganj. He purchases goods from the market of Korvon.  He has regular customers and he gets a good income. Murivatsho would like to get a loan of 5400 Somoni for purchasing of household goods and expansion of his business. 

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy household items for resale.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is a married woman with four children, three of whom attend school while one is still too young for school. They own a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and transport costs.

For the past four years, she has operated a beauty salon business which has improved her living standards. Her clients are her neighbours and passersby. Christine faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of owning a well-furnished beauty salon and a cosmetic shop in the future.

With the Kshs 60,000 she wants to furnish her beauty salon, purchase mirrors, chairs and a refrigerator to sell soft drinks to her customers. She decided to work with Yehu to access loans to uplift her business standard.

loans.use: To furnish her beauty salon, purchase mirrors, chairs and a refrigerator to sell soft drinks to her customers.

loans.name: Idrissa's Group

texts.en:
Salone Micronfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you teachers of the Sinkunia Junior Secondary School from Kabala town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 2005 by a UNICEF-sponsored project “Sababu Education” to promote education in the region. The school is staffed with 11 employees and has 225 pupils. 

Staff from various school and other government offices within SMT's operational areas come to SMT to seek loans. At the end of each month, these institutions' bursars are directly responsible for deducting the repayment from their salaries and pays SMT on the teachers' behalf. With the help of these loans, these teachers can do or buy things that their mere salaries alone can not do or buy. 

The leader of this group of teachers is Idrissa S.. The 32-year-old Idrissa was born in Makeni. He has been in the teaching profession for seven years now.  He is married and has two children who are attending primary school and secondary school. Mr. S. is going to use his share of this loan to invest in his farm and to pay his college fees. 

(Included on the left of the photo is loan officer Rosaline Turay.)

loans.use: To invest in his farm and to pay his college fees.

loans.name: Sangoné

texts.fr:
Monsieur Sangoné S.  est un yoffois de 32 ans. Il habite dans la localité de Yoff. Il est marié et père  d’un enfant de 5 ans. Depuis  plus de 10ans il exerce l’activité de menuisier métallique  dans un atelier de la place. Il a choisi cette occupation sous la recommandation de ses parents. Aussi  cela constitue pour lui une source de revenus pour s’occuper de sa famille. 
	Monsieur S. est membre du guichet de Yoff depuis aout 2008. Il sollicite un crédit de 75 000 FRS  prévu pour l’achat d’un petit matériel qui va l’aider a rendre son travail plus performant. Son objectif  est d’accroitre ses gains et d’améliorer les conditions sociales de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Sangoné S. is 32 years old and lives in the town of Yoff.  He is married and the father of a 5-year-old.  He has worked for more than ten years as a metal joiner in a local workshop, an occupation he chose on the recommendation of his parents, and because it is a good source of income for him to support his family.

Mr. S. has been a member of the Yoff bank since August 2008.  He is requesting a loan of 75,000 FRS for the purchase of small equipment which will help him better perform in his work.  His goal is to increase his earnings and improve living conditions for his family.

loans.use: to buy work tools

loans.name: Furqat

texts.en:
Furqat is a hardworking and active man who is married and has a child. He works in a bakery. His wife helps him and they work hard to feed their child and implement all their conditions of life. He cooks 500 loaves of bread per day. He has six regular customers who resell his bread in the market.  He would like to get a loan of 5000 Somoni for purchasing flour which will allow him to expand his business.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To buy flour.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and rent bills. 

For the past two years, she has been selling second-hand clothes wholesale and retail, at the market and from door to door. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. During the holiday season the demand for clothes is higher while during the months of January to July the demand is lower. Caroline dreams of establishing a clothes-selling stall in the future.

With the Kshs 40,000 she wants to purchase five bales of used clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her business.

loans.use: To purchase five bales of used clothes for resale.

loans.name: Jerusha

texts.en:
Jerusha, a married woman with two school-going children, lives with her family in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food for the family. For the past four years, Jerusha has operated a clothing business, selling wholesale, retail, at the market, and door to door in her neighboring community.

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to uplift her business, and will purchase dresses and socks with the Kshs 20,000 loan she is requesting. Jerusha, who faces the major challenge of high transportation costs as she goes about selling clothes, dreams of establishing her own selling stall in the future.

loans.use: to purchase dresses and socks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel G. W. is 46 years old and married. He is a hardworking businessman who runs a grocery store and sells charcoal and snacks. He has been in business for four years. He previously earned a living as a farmer.

Samuel has requested a loan for 30,000 KES to buy charcoal and vegetables. He believes that through Faulu Kenya, he will expand his business and open a cafeteria in the future.

loans.use: To buy charcoal and vegetables

loans.name: Sylivia

texts.en:
Sylivia N. is married and has five children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of her maids. Sylivia lives in the Kyebando Nsooba neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity but doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include food and school fees.

Sylivia sells charcoal. She has been in this business for less than one year, and she works seven days a week. She sells her products in a retail shop from which she also generates additional income. The main business challenges for Sylivia include thieves and the rainy season.

Sylivia has requested a loan of 2,000,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to own a delivery van and educate her children up to university level.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Sevak

texts.en:
Sevak H. lives in Talin with his brother and pensioner parents. Together with his mother, he is engaged in agriculture. Sevak’s brother, Gevorg, and father, Tigran, are engaged in construction, trying to help to improve the family’s living conditions. 

Sevak keeps a farm, but he doesn’t have his own land.  With the requested loan, Sevak plans to buy 0.820 land and grow forage for livestock.

loans.use: to pay for land

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past two years, Hellen has operated a beauty salon; she works at the market, with ladies being her potential customers. She faces the major challenge of seasonality in her business.

Hellen decided to work with Yehu to access loans to raise her living standards. With a 20,000 KES loan she she wants to purchase cosmetics and hair weaves. She dreams of owning a well-furnished beauty salon shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and hair weaves

loans.name: Shushanik

texts.en:
Together with her disabled daughter, Shushanik A. lives in Stepanavan, Armenia. Shushanik is a farmer. She has an orchard where she grows apple trees, plum trees and grapes. She also has a dairy made up of seven heads of cattle.

Shushanik has applied to SEF for a loan to increase her livestock. With the loan she plans to buy two bulls.

loans.use: To buy two bulls

loans.name: Suren

texts.en: Suren H. lives in Katnaghbyur with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and grandson. Suren and his wife are engaged in agriculture and his son works abroad. The family gets its main income from agriculture. The household economy includes seven cows, two sheep and 15 chickens. Suren cultivates 0.3 hectares of potato. He also grows apple, grape and plum trees. Suren applied to SEF to buy a cow.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 26-year-old single man living with his parents and eight siblings. He is from Lebanon. He has worked as a taxi driver since 2006. In addition, he works as a private driver transporting students and teachers from their houses to the school and vice versa. This young man recently had an accident which led to a paralysis in his hand. So, he had to attend expensive physiotherapy sessions in order to get the crucial treatment for him to recover. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to perform the necessary maintenance on his car and purchase a new engine. This will allow him to transport the customers suitably without facing any vehicle damages. He is in real need of earning a good income to handle his health expenses and help his family with the household budget.

loans.use: to perform the necessary maintenance on his car and purchase a new engine.

loans.name: Allan

texts.en:
Allan M. W. is a member of the Joyland Group in Faulu, Kenya. He sells household items to earn a living. He has been running the business for two years with two employees. He was previously working in a studio before he went into business.

Through Faulu Kenya, Allan has been trained in financial management. This has helped him to run his business smoothly for two years. He is requesting a loan of 20,000 KES to buy secondhand furniture, TVs and DVDs to sell.

loans.use: To buy secondhand furniture, TVs and DVDs to sell

loans.name: Andrew A.y.'s Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers of the RC Junior Secondary School from Kabala, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded by the Roman Catholic Mission in 1954 to promote education. Over the years, the school has produced a great number of lecturers, teachers, and other professionals in different walks of life. Currently, the school has 18 staff members and 637 pupils.  

This is the first loan that RC Junior Secondary School from Kabala is accessing from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

Sixty-seven-year-old Andrew A.Y. M. is the leader of this group of teachers and has been a teacher himself for 41 years. He was born in Kabala township and is married with four children: one in secondary school, two in college and one no longer attending school. Andrew will use his loan to pay his children's college fees.

loans.use: To pay his children's college fees

loans.name: Arbak

texts.en: Arbak S. lives in Shamb community in Syunik region. He works at a hydro power plant. Arbak and his family are engaged in agriculture. He has a small cattle farm and apple orchid. Arbak also has his own land and wants to develop his farm, but he hasn’t got the financial means to purchase high quality seeds. It is not the first time that Arbak has borrowed from SEF. With the requested loan, he plans to buy seeds and develop his farm.

loans.use: to pay for seeds.

loans.name: Pauline  Akinyi

texts.en:
Pauline Akinyi O. has been a tailor for one year and earns an income of KES. 15,000 per month. Her business is located in the Babadogo region in Nairobi, and most of her clients are residents of the same region.

She is married to Nelson and they are blessed with five school-going children. She learned about KADET LTD through a friend. She is applying for her first loan of KES. 30,000 to purchase more fabric for dresses.

She will use income from the proceeds of this loan to invest back into the business, and also to pay for her children's education.

loans.use: To purchase fabric to make dresses

loans.name: Dickson

texts.en: Dickson is 23 years old and married with a three-year-old son. He has been quarrying for two years to earn a living. Since he joined Faulu Kenya, he has learned how to save his money. This has helped him in managing his finances. He has also benefited by being able to share business ideas with his group members in Faulu Kenya. He has requested 20,000 KES to buy tools and buy more land for quarrying.

loans.use: To buy tools and buy more land for quarrying

loans.name: Agriphina

texts.en:
Agriphina is a married woman with two school-going children. They live in a rented house that has electricity but no running water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past year, she has operated a beauty salon, where her potential customers are neighbors and friends. 

Agriphina faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding it in the future. With the Kshs 25,000 she is requesting she wants to purchase cosmetics and chemicals for her beauty salon. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase cosmetics and chemicals for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Norayr

texts.en: Norayr B. lives in Ashotavan, a community in the Syunik region of Armenia. He is engaged in agriculture with his family. He has a small farm. Norayr has his own land where he plans to grow barley. Unfortunately, he isn’t able to develop a farm because of health problems, so he also wants to buy bee hives. Norayr expects to get more income by selling barley and honey  to meet his family’s daily needs. He doesn’t have sufficient funds, so he has applied to SEF to increase his income and to implement his plans.

loans.use: to pay for bee hives

loans.name: Eleonora

texts.en:
Eleonora C. lives in Samtredia District, in the village of Dabla Gomi. She is 56 years old and lives with her husband, two sons, and her daughter-in-law. A couple of weeks ago, she became a grandmother and now they have an infant boy in the home. 

Eleonora’s sons are in military service. Eleonora and her husband are heading the family agricultural business: a small dairy farm, which consists of four milk cows. The end-product – 20 kg of traditional Georgian cheese is sold on the market. They also have a plot of the land where maize is grown. From the harvested 6 tons of maize only 600 kg is sold and the rest is used in the farm. Also the family owns a lemon garden, which gives them 500 kg of lemon per year. These are sold locally. Along the above-mentioned, Eleonora had 30 bee-hives with bee colonies. 24 colonies were destroyed because of unfavorable weather conditions last year. Now only six bee colonies are left.

The requested credit will be used for further development of their farm, in particular – 50% of the credit will be used for purchasing 10 new bee colonies. The rest will be used for cultivation of the land and purchasing 250 chickens. The chickens will be sold in a couple of months at double the price. 

After this investment the income of the family will significantly increase. Eleonora hopes that they will be able to put aside some savings and purchase a car for the family.

loans.use: tu purchase bee colonies, fuel for tractor and chickens for poultry business.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik V. was born in 1970. He is married with two daughters. Gagik’s older daughter is a student, and younger one is a pupil. For over 20 years Gagik has been a bee keeper in Nerkin Hand village, an area of Kapan. He likes his occupation very much and therefore works very hard. Gagik sells his honey to villagers, and also distributes honey to Kapan and Yerevan cities. Thanks to his business income Gagik provides for his family’s needs and pays for his older daughter’s education.   
Gagik needs a 600,000 AMD loan to increase the number of his bee hives, and also to buy wax paper and frames for his business. This is Gagik’s fifth loan from Nor Horizon. He has never delayed his repayments.

loans.use: To increase his number of bee hives, and also to buy wax papers and frames

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, cooking oil and soap to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old man, engaged to be married,  from Lebanon. He is living with his parents and one sibling. He has worked in the construction field for more than 12 years, and in 2000, he started running his own business. He is especially talented at completing drywall projects. He works closely with multiple construction projects and he also manages houses in his village and its surroundings. 

He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was very satisfied with the results. Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to buy construction tools and supplies because his business is growing and he's planning to work on bigger projects.

loans.use: to buy construction tools and supplies.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a married woman, with one child who attends school. She rents a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family. She has operated a clothes-selling business for the past two years, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are the neighboring community members. 

With the Kshs 15,000 she is requesting, Joan wants to purchase two bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to get access to loans so she can improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase two bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Clovice

texts.en: Clovice is a fifty-year-old married man with four children, living in his own house in Fort Portal, Uganda. He is his family's sole supporter, and his desire is to educate his children up to the university level. He has been selling popcorn for ten years and the business is profitable. His biggest challenge is that supplies are low and prices are high due to drought. His desire is to own a food store. Clovice needs the loan to buy popcorn to sell.

loans.use: to buy popcorn to sell

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is married to a teacher. They have five children:  four have graduated from school and one still attends school. They live in a house that they rent; it has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for her family.

For the past 20 years, she has operated a fish-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors. Mary's biggest business challenge is the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 20,000 she wants to purchase sacks of fish and cooking oil. Mary decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to gain access to loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish and cooking oil

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a married woman with four school-going children. They live in a house that they rent; it has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. For the past three years, she has operated a retail shop, selling household goods, sugar, corn flour, wheat flour, rice, and tea leaves.

Grace has been able to educate her children and provide for their basic needs from her profits. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of establishing more businesses in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, corn flour and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, corn flour and cooking oil

loans.name: Asiimwe

texts.en: Asiimwe is a 37-year-old married woman with four children living in her own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She takes care of the family with the help of her husband, who is a tailor.  Their goal is to educate their children.  For eight years, Asiimwe has been selling second-hand clothes and this has helped her support the family.  She has challenges of natural hazards such as rain. Her desire is to own a shop and stop vending.  Asiimwe needs the loan to buy clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Seyidkhanim

texts.en:
Seyidkhanim S. is from Agsu. She is a 60-year-old married woman.  Seyidkhanim is married, with two sons and one daughter, who are all married.

For the past five years, Seyidkhanim has been engaged in the poultry business. She sells to buyers in the Agsu bazaar. With this business, Seyidkhanim helps her big family pay its daily bills. She requested a loan in the amount of 900 AZN to buy more chickens. Seyidkhanim plans to use the profit from this loan to build a henhouse. This is her first loan with Aqroinvest and Kiva.

loans.use: to build a henhouse and buy more chickens

loans.name: Edith

texts.en:
Edith is a single woman who lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. She has operated a cloth-selling business for the past six months, selling at retail to her neighbors and passersby.

In addition, she operates a telephone service for another source of income. Edith faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the Kshs 10,000 she is requesting, Edith would like to purchase bundles of cloth and scratch cards to sell. Edith decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of cloth and scratch cards to sell.

loans.name: Revaz

texts.en:
Revaz D. is 59 years old and lives in Samtredia, Imereti Region, together with his family – his wife and his 31-year-old son. His wife Darejan works as a nurse in a local medical institution and earns 200 Laris per month. 

Revaz is heading the agricultural business of the family and gets average monthly income of 400 Laris. He has a small pig farm consisting of two pigs and 17 piglets. He sells the piglets locally. He also runs small poultry farm and sells approximately 3,600 chickens annually. Revaz grows maize on his own land with an area of 1 ha - the whole harvest of maize is used in his farm.

With the requested loan, Revaz plans to purchase 1500 chickens, which will be sold after a month with approximately 200% price mark-up.

With the increase in income, Revaz plans to expand the building of the poultry farm, so he will be able to expand the scale of the business – raise more chickens.

loans.use: to purchase chickens.

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es: Victor Manuel es un joven de 22 años que desde muy niño, buscaba la forma de generar ingresos, haciendo trabajos academicos; a los 12 impulsado por su espiritu emprendedor e independiente, empezò a trabajar como  ayudante en una panaderia haciendo los domicilios y cuando  en este negocio su propietario abrió otro  de comidas rápidas, se propuso a aprender; asì fue como al año siguiente, a los 13 de edad, ya sabia prepararlas y poco a poco creò el suyo propio hasta lograr comprar  implementos de trabajo,aunque aun no tiene un carro de perros propio, pero tiene una meta y es la de comprarlo, ya que le hace mucha falta y el que utiliza es alquilado; esta es la razòn por la cual recurre a la Fundaciòn Mario Santo Domingo para aplicar a su primer credikiva con el cual cumplira su meta. Su sueño es terminar sus estudios de Fìsica en la Universidad pues ya està en su sexto semestre, asi mismo tener un local propio donde pueda ofrecer un confortable servicio a sus clientes. Su mayor desafio ha sido el arrendamiento de un carro de perros que sea muy funcional porque el que maneja en la actualidad tiene un solo freidor y una plancha, el cual  le ofrece muy poco espacio de trabajo, de todas maneras dia a dia se esfuerza para aumentar su utilidad que es no menor del 55% y su credikiva comprarà su carro de perros.
texts.en: Victor Manuel is a young man who is 22 years old and since he was very young he looked for a way to generate an income by carrying out academic work. At the age of 12 years old, motivated by an enterprising spirit and independence, he started to work as an assistant in a neighborhood bakery. And when the owner opened another business selling fast foods he set out to learn the business. The following year, at the age of 13, he knew how to prepare foods and slowly he began to make a business of his own once he finally was able to purchase tools for his work. Even though he still does not have a cart of his own he has a personal goal of purchasing one. He really needs one especially because the one he uses is rented. This is the reason why he has approached Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo (Kiva Field Partner) to apply for his first Kiva loan, through which he will reach his goal. His dream is to complete his university studies in Physics; he is already on his sixth semester. His greatest challenge has been to rent a food cart that is highly functional because the one he currently rents only has one fryer and one skillet, giving him very little space to work. But despite this he works day after day to increase his profits. They never fall below 55%. And his Kiva loan will be used to purchase a food cart.

loans.use: to purchase a hotdog cart

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of charcoal for resale.

loans.name: Jesukpego 13 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe JESUKPEGO 13 est composé de trois personnes qui vendent toutes dans le même marché de Djassin à Porto-Novo, capitale administrative du Bénin. C'est la deuxième fois que ce groupe sollicite l'aide financier de ALIDé, afin d'élever le niveau de son activité. 
La représentante du groupe, du nom de Aïchatou est celle qui a la main levée sur la photo. Aïchatou est née en 1960 à Zinvié à Porto-Novo et est marié à Saliou. Le couple a quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, mais qui ne sont plus à leur charge. Aïchatou et son mari assurent ensemble les différentes charges de la famille. Depuis huit ans, Aïchatou vit à Djassin avec son mari. Afin de se prendre en charge et d'améliorer son niveau de vie, Aïchatou  exerce depuis quinze ans, comme activité la vente de divers condiments de sauce et aussi de l'huile de palme, qu'elle achète au marché de Ouando à Porto-Novo. Dans la quête de la satisfaction de sa clientèle et pour accroître son revenu, Aïchatou sollicite à nouveau un crédit. Son ambition est d'acquérir un jour, une parcelle.
texts.en:
The JESUKPEGO 13 group is made up of three women who all sell in the same market in the Djassin neighborhood of Porto-Novo, Benin’s administrative capital.  This is the second time that the group is requesting financial aid from ALIDé, in order to increase their business activity.
The group representative, named Aïchatou, is the woman in the photo with her hand raised.  She was born in 1960 in Zinvié, Porto-Novo, and is married to Saliou.  The couple has four children, all of whom are in school but in the care of others.  She and her husband together share the family expenses.  For the last eight years, Aïchatou has lived in Djassin with her husband.  In order to improve their quality of life, she has been in business for 15 years selling different condiments, sauces, and palm oil, which she buys in the Ouando market in Porto-Novo.  To satisfy her customers and increase her income, Aïchatou is requesting a new loan.  Her goal is to one day buy a piece of land.

loans.use: to buy baskets of condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.)

loans.name: Mutesi

texts.en:
V. is 38 years old and single. She sells a variety of men's clothing. V. has been in this business for six years and her shop is open from 8 am until 8 pm every day. Her business is well organized.

V. has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase more clothing to sell. With the profit from the proceeds of this loan, V. will be able to save for her future and to reinvest in her business.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Saumu

texts.en:
Saumu is a married woman, with five children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For the past year, she has operated a food stall business, making dumplings and rice for sale.  Saumu faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  She dreams of expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 10,000 she wants to purchase cooking oil for her food stall. Saumu decided to work with Yehu to gain access to loans to boost her small business.

loans.use: To purchase cooking oil for her food stall

loans.name: Sandra Milena

texts.es:
Ofrecerle a sus tres hijos la posibilidad de estudiar en una Universidad es el sueño de Sandra Milena C., quien después de trabajar como empleada en algunas cafeterías decidió crear su propio negocio, una cafetería en la que trabaja de domingo a domingo desde tempranas horas con la esperanza de mejorar su calidad de vida. 

Sandra espera ampliar su negocio y para ello necesita de un préstamo que le permita comprar surtido para ampliar su oferta de productos y generar más ventas.
texts.en:
Sandra Milena C.'s dream is to offer her three children the opportunity to study in university. After she was employed in cafeterias she decided to set up her own business. She has a cafeteria that she opens for business from Sunday to Sunday from the very early morning hours.  Her hope is to improve her quality of life. 

Sandra wants to expand her business and for this reason she needs a loan. This will permit her to purchase inventory to increase the variety of products she offers and to generate more sales.

loans.use: to purchase inventory for her store

loans.name: Adjoko

texts.fr: Couturière de profession, Mme Adjoko  est âgée de 40ans et réside à Djidjolé. Depuis 2008 elle a crée son salon de couture et emploi 02 personnes.  Elle fait la confection des habits et rideaux et revend à toutes personnes.  Elle achète les tissus de rideau et les pagnes au Grand marché de Lomé. Ce premier  prêt lui servira à acheter 25m de tissu rideau et  10 pièces de pagnes pour transformer afin de revendre aux clients et à toutes personnes. Mme est une vaillante femme dynamique elle a des ambitions acheter un terrain pour construire sa propre maison  et avoir pour éviter de payer les frais du loyer.
texts.en: Mrs. Adjoko is a 40 year old seamstress and lives in Djidjolé. She set up her sewing shop in 2008 and employs 2 people. She makes clothing and curtains and sells them to everyone. She buys the curtain fabric and pagnes (a colorful West African cloth)  in the Lomé Grand Market. This first loan will be used to buy 25m of curtain fabric and 10 pagne pieces which she will turn into clothing and curtains and sell to her customers. She is a brave, energetic woman who has ambitions to buy land so that she can build her own home and avoid paying for rent.

loans.use: To buy curtain fabric and pagnes

loans.name: Dative

texts.en: Dative is 48 years old and is married with seven children between the ages 10 and 25 years old. She has been selling shoes and bags for four years and her business is well-organized. She works from 7am until 7pm every day. She has requested a loan from Kiva lenders in order to purchase more shoes and bags to sell. Dative will reinvest the profits in her business and save for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more shoes and bags

loans.name: Marling Odily

texts.es: Marling Odily se dedica a la venta de productos veterinarios, hace más de 2 años que tiene este negocio. Ella ha puesto mucho empeño por mejorar su negocio, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos para su negocio. Ella trabaja de manera independiente, por lo que siempre le ha gustado interactuar con sus clientes ya que ellos les piden consejos con los diferentes medicamentos que necesitan para sus mascotas. Este crédito es para la compra alimentos, pastillas, medicamentos, tratamientos entre otros productos.
texts.en: Marling Odily sells veterinary products. She has had this business for 2 years. She has put a lot of hard work into improving her business and it is not the first time that she has taken a loan for her business. She works independently and she has always enjoyed interacting with her clients. They ask for advice with the various medications that they need for their pets. This loan will be used to purchase pet food, tablets, medicines, treatments, and other products.

loans.use: to purchase pet food, tablets, medicines, treatments and other products

loans.name: Dadja

texts.fr: Mr Dadja est un jeune homme âgé de 29ans. Sa conjointe est une couturière et ils ont un(01) enfant en charge. Il a un grand salon de couture (JULES CESAR CREATION) qu’il a crée en 2006. Il achète les tissus veste et chemise, les confectionne et les revend à ses nombreux clients et à toutes personnes. Il a 25 apprentis. Il veut  ce premier prêt pour acheter  50m de tissu veste et 100m de tissu chemise pour confectionner plus de vestes et de chemises pour satisfaire toutes personnes, assurer un avenir meilleur à sa famille.
texts.en: Mr Dadja is a 29 year-old young man. His wife is a seamstress and they have one  dependent child. He has a large clothing shop (JULES CESAR CREATIONS) that he founded in 2006. He buys fabric for jackets and shirts, and makes and sells them to his many customers. He has 25 apprentices. He wants this first loan to buy 50m of jacket fabric and 100m of shirt fabric to make more shirts and jackets to satisfy everyone, thereby ensuring a better future for his family.

loans.use: To buy fabric for jackets and shirts

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Mariée à un sociologue, Yawa a un(01) enfant et est âgée de 40ans. Elle fait du jus de bissap de citron et d’ananas.  C’est depuis 2008 qu’elle a commencé l’activité, Elle s’approvisionne à Lomé et revend dans sa maison. Une(01) personne l’aide à faire du jus pour vendre. Elle a payé le premier prêt sans aucune difficulté et elle est à sa seconde demande pour acheter 02 sacs de riz, 10 sacs de bissap et 05 sacs de citron. Elle veut vendre du jus pour avoir du profit et s’occuper  en partie du foyer.
texts.en:
Yawa is 40 years old, has one child and is married to a sociologist. She makes bissap (dried hibiscus flower), lemon and pineapple juice, a business which she started in 2008. She obtains her supplies in Lomé and sells in front of her house. She is assisted by one person in making the juice.

Yawa repaid her first loan with no problems and is requesting a second to buy 2 bags of rice, 10 sacks of bissap and 5 bags of lemons. She wants to sell juice in order to make a profit and take care of part of the household responsibilities.

loans.use: to buy 2 bags of sugar, 10 bags of bissap and 5 bags of lemons

loans.name: Phelister

texts.en:
Phelister is a married woman, with two children who attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent and school fees.

For the past four years, she has operated a cafe, selling to her neighbors and passersby.  With the Kshs 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, beans and maize flour. She dreams of growing her business in future.  She decided to join Yehu, to gain access to loans that will boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, cooking oil, beans and maize flour.

loans.name: Diane

texts.en:
Diane is 29 years old and single. She owns a small business selling various styles of men's clothes. She employs one person from her community as a helper and her hours of business are from 6 a.m. until 6 p.m. every day. This is her tenth successful year of business.

Diane has requested her first loan from Kiva lenders via Vision Finance Company in order to expand her business by purchasing bales of clothes. This loan will allow her to attract more customers, which will help her earn more profit. With this profit, Diane will reinvest in her business and save for her future.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes

loans.name: Ernesto

texts.es:
La parte de atrás de la casa de Ernesto G. Álavrez es el lugar donde realiza las herraduras de acero que vende a un comercializador de la ciudfad de Medellín, el oficio lo aprendió desde pequeño al lado de su padre y fue cuando se casé y llegó su primer hijo cuando se vio en la necesidad de trabajar como independiente debido a la falta de oportunidades laborales en su pueblo de origen, Sonsón Antioquia. 

Ernesto es un emprendedor que sueña con ofrecerle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia y por eso, se esfuerza día a día por mejorar la calidad de su producto y producir más para incrementar sus ventas, para ello, necesita de un préstamo con el que comprará materia prima.
texts.en:
The rear section of Ernesto G. Alvarez's house is where carries out his steel welding projects. He sells the products to a merchant in the city of Medellin. He learned the business when he was very young from his father. When he married and when he had his first child he realized the need to work independently, given the lack of work opportunities in his village of origin, Sonson Antioquia.

Ernesto is an entrepreneur that dreams of providing his family with a better quality of life and for this reason he works hard day after day to improve his products and increase production and sales. He needs a loan to purchase work materials.

loans.use: to purchase welding materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and cooking oil.

loans.name: Hector Alonso

texts.es:
Hector se siente orgullosos de ser campesino, pues el campo le ha permitido cultivar las lechugas que hoy en día son su fuente de sustento, pues la falta de oportunidades laborales y la necesidad de cubrir los gastos de la familia, lo impulsaron para inventarse la vida como él mismo lo dice. 

Desde hace un año, Hector cultiva las lechugas en su pedacito de tierra, actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas que le permitan mejorar su producción para sacar un producto de buena calidad que lo posicione en el mercado y le permita incrementar sus ventas para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Hector is proud to be a farmer. The land has helped him cultivate lettuce and today that is his source of support. There is a lack of work opportunities and the need to cover his family’s expenses motivated him to invent himself a living, as he says. 

For the past year, Hector has cultivated lettuce on a small plot of land. He needs a loan to purchase agricultural materials that will help him improve production and to have good quality produce to sell in the markets. This will increase his sales and it will help improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase two bales of second hand clothes for resale.

loans.name: Rosa Ofelia

texts.es:
A sus 59 años de edad, Rosa Ofelia es una mujer emprendedora que lucha por su familia, por mejorar su calidad de vida y por tener una vejez tranquila, por ello, decidió poner en su propia casa un negocio de videojuegos para lograr un mejor futuro. 

Rosa espera ampliar su negocio para incrementar sus ingresos, para ello necesita de un préstamo para comprar una consola de videojuego.
texts.en:
At 59 years of age, Rosa Ofelia is an enterprising woman who struggles for her family, to improve their quality of life and to have a quiet old age. She has set up a video game business in her house to achieve a better future. 

Rosa wants to expand her business in order to improve her income. She needs a loan to purchase a video game console.

loans.use: to purchase a video console

loans.name: Consolata

texts.en:
Consolata is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. Her husband is a driver and he supports his family financially. They live at a house that they own. Their home has electricity but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a video shop business for the past five years. Her potential customers are neighbours and passersby. Consolata faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 30,000 she wants to purchase cassettes for her video business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase cassettes for her video business.

loans.name: Juan Albeiro

texts.es:
Juan Albeiro aprendió desde pequeño al lado de su padre el oficio de ser vendedor ambulante y es así como actualmente se gana la vida y solventa su hogar conformado por su esposa y sus cuatro hijos, que aunque como él mismo lo afirma “no vivimos a las anchas pero por lo menos nos alcanza para comer”. 

Este emprendedor es consciente de que sus ventas se ven afectadas por las razones climáticas lo que afecta su venta diaria, pues en los días de mucho invierno, no se hace ni para los pasajes. Actualmente Juan Albeiro necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido y así aumentar sus ventas para mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Juan Albeiro learned from his father when he was very young the business of being an itinerant salesperson. And this is how he currently earns a living and how he supports his family, consisting of his wife and their four children. Although he says that they are not able to live large they have enough to eat. 

This entrepreneur is conscious that his sales are being affected by the climate, impacting on his daily sales. During the heavy days of winter he doesn't even make enough for his transportation fare.  Juan Albeiro needs a loan to purchase inventory in order to increase his sales and improve his income.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for his retail store

loans.name: Bernardo

texts.es:
Bernardo forma parte del banco comunal “Premio al esfuerzo”, perteneciente a la ciudad de Concepción. Él tiene una rosticería, ésta es una tienda de alimentos, en la cual vende  carne, cecinas, bebidas, está surtido y abastecido de muchos productos. Bernardo se dedica a éste rubro desde hace 7 meses. Su mercadería la compra usualmente en distribuidoras, vega y proveedores de sus productos que llegan a su local.   
Su local lo tiene ubicado en la casa de su madre, ya que ella le cedió una parte de su patio, su local está muy bien ubicado por lo que cuenta con mucha clientela. Su horario laboral es de lunes a domingo de 8ºº de la mañana hasta las 11ºº de la noche.
Con éste préstamo comprará mercadería y sus metas son ampliar su negocio, por lo que está siendo asesorado por un arquitecto para concretar su proyecto. Ya que necesita más espacio para ubicar sus productos.
Su sueño es comprar una camioneta para trasladar su mercadería.
Bernardo vive junto a su madre, quien recibe una pensión de viudez. Por esto su motivación de comenzar éste negocio, ya que ha podido colaborar con los gastos del hogar económicamente.
Bernardo está muy agradecido del crédito obtenido por Fondo esperanza, ya que sin ésta ayuda no hubiera sido posible, comenzar su negocio. Además está muy contento de la orientación y motivación recibida. Respecto al grupo del banco comunal él se siente muy cómodo en las reuniones realizadas, ya que estas son muy gratas.
Concepción, está asentada en la desembocadura del río Bíobío, uno de los más grandes del país, al sur de Chile, en la región del Bíobío. Ha tenido una importante función en nuestra historia, siendo sede de importantes batallas y asentamiento relevante, especialmente durante la Guerra de Arauco, por estar en la frontera con territorio mapuche. Actualmente la ciudad posee un importante desarrollo económico y demográfico, llegando a ser considerada como uno de los núcleos urbanos, demográfico, administrativo, financiero y comercial más relevantes de Chile, después de Santiago y Valparaíso.
texts.en:
Bernardo is a member of the communal bank named "A Prize for Effort", located in the city of Concepcion. He has a rotisserie and this is a food store. There he sells meats, jerky, and drinks. The store is stocked with a variety of many products. Bernando has had his business for 7 months. He usually purchases his merchandise from distributors and sales people that come to his store. 

He has his store installed in his mother's house. She has given him a part of her patio and his store is very well located, which is why he has so many clients. His works schedule is from Monday to Sunday from 8am to 11pm. 

With this loan he will purchase merchandise and his goal is to expand his business. An assessment by an architect is being done to materialize his project. He needs more room to place his products.

His dream is to purchase a pick-up truck with which to transport his merchandise. 

Bernardo lives with his mother and she receives an old age pension. His motivation to start his business was to be able to financially contribute towards the household expenses.

Bernardo is very thankful for the loan he obtained through Fondo Esperanza (Kiva Field Partner).  Without this support it would not have been possible to start his business. He also is very happy with the training and motivation he has received. With respect to his communal bank he is very comfortable with the meetings, especially because they are so enjoyable.

The city of Concepcion is nestled at the mouth of the Biobio River. It is one of the largest in the country, at Chile's south, and in the region of Biobio. It has had an important function in our history, being the site of important battles and relevant settlements, especially during the War of Arauco, for being at the border of the Mapuche territory. The city is currently seeing an important economic and demographic development. It is now considered to be one of the most relevant urban centers in Chile, pertaining to demographics, administration, economy, and commerce. It is second only to Santiago and Valparaiso.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items for his store

loans.name: Fabiola De Jesús

texts.es:
Desde pequeña Fabiola ha tenido gran habilidad para las manualidades, arte que convirtió en su forma de ganarse la vida después de separarse de su esposo y quedar a cargo del hogar y de sus 2 hijos, desde entonces se dedicó a realizar manualidades para la venta y así salir adelante como madre cabeza de hogar. 

Aunque actualmente Fabiola realiza sus manualidades desde la comunidad del hogar, esta emprendedora espera ampliar su negocio y ganar reconocimiento para incrementar sus ventas y ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia. 

Fabiola necesita de un préstamo para comprar materia prima y ampliar su portafolio de productos para captar más clientes y crecer poco a poco.
texts.en:
Since she was very young, Fabiola has had a great ability for crafting. It is an art form that she developed into her way to earn a living after she separated from her husband and she was left in charge of the household and her two children. Since then she has made crafts for sale, in order to come out ahead as the head of the household.

Although she currently makes her crafts from the comfort of her home this enterprising woman wants to expand her business and to earn recognition for increasing her sales and for providing her family with a better future.

Fabiola needs a loan to purchase materials and to expand her portfolio of products in order to capture more clients and grow incrementally.

loans.use: to purchase crafting materials

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a single woman who lives at a rental house that has neither electricity, nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. For the past four years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling retail, to her neighbours and passersby. 

In addition, Josephine operates a shoes selling business which contributes to her other source of income. She faces a major challenge of delayed payments by those who purchase goods on credit. She dreams of opening more businesses in the future.

With a loan of KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bundles of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of clothes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy hair extensions and a variety of hair care items

loans.name: Iftisam

texts.en:
Iftisam is a 30-year-old mother of three from the Negev. For reasons of modesty, Iftisam wears a veil in her photograph. Iftisam prepares handmade weaving and artwork. She runs her business part-time to develop much needed income for her family. She also works part-time as a speciA. needs Teacher's Assistant. Iftisam has been managing her business for just over 18 months and has gained a reputation for quality goods.

She needed this loan to purchase cloth, yarn, beads and the specialty screens needed to create her products.

Iftisam eventually wants to open a small shop in the center of her village so she can expand her business and provide for her children.

loans.use: to purchase cloth, yarn, beads and the specialty screens needed to create her products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase sacks of fish and cooking oil.

loans.name: Aniam

texts.en:
Aniam is from Israel's Negev region. She has brought an amazing business to her village, a book rental library store. From her home Aniam rents books and provides story times and reading programs for school children. She also has books for adults. Aniam's dream has enriched her entire village with access to reading.

Aniam needed this loan to expand her book collection and purchase shelves and supplies.

Her dream is to open a central rental library which will have a wide selection of literature, with reading programs for all ages and story times for youth.

loans.use: to expand her book collection and purchase shelves and supplies.

loans.name: Jocelyne

texts.fr: Née en 1983 à Avrankou, dans le département de l'Ouémé, Jocelyne vit depuis cinq ans à Sèdjè à Avrankou. Jocelyne est mariée à Pierre, un marchand, et est mère de deux enfants tous scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Jocelyne n'a pas été à l'école. Pour faire face à ses besoins, Jocelyne mène comme activité principale, la vente de nourriture (pâte de maïs accompagnée de sauce, farine de manioc) ; ce qui lui permet d'assurer les besoins de sa famille. De façon secondaire, Jocelyne vend des boissons à son domicile. Jocelyne achète ses produits à Cotonou, capitale économique du Bénin. En vue de satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Jocelyne sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Les crédits précédemment obtenus ont tous été bien remboursés. Dans l'avenir, Jocelyne désire acquérir une parcelle.
texts.en:
Born in 1983 in Avrankou, in the department of Oueme, Jocelyne has been living in Sedje for five years. Jocelyne is married to Pierre, a salesman, and is a mother of two; both children attend school. The couple jointly takes care of the household's various expenses. Jocelyne did not go to school.
To provide for her expenses, Jocelyne's main occupation is food retailing (corn paste with sauce, cassava flour); this allows her to support her family. Jocelyne supplements this activity by selling beverages door-to-door. Jocelyne purchases her products in Cotonou, the economic capital of Benin. In order to meet her clientele's needs, Jocelyne is requesting financial help from ALIDe for the second time. The loans she was granted before well all correctly paid back. In the future, Jocelyne wishes to purchase a plot of land.

loans.use: to purchase corn, cassava flour and beverages

loans.name: Sultan

texts.en:
Sultan is a married woman with two children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity, but not piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are rent bills and school fees.

She has operated a food stall business, including fruit juice sales, for the past three years. She sells the food and juice in a shop, to her neighbours. Sultan faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice and fruit for making fruit juice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to expand her business.

loans.use: To purchase bundles of wheat flour, rice and fruit for making fruit juice.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son del barrio María Auxiliadora de la ciudad de Caacupe, que dista a 38 km de la oficina regional dicha ciudad.
La presidenta del comité es la señora Limpia Concepción S. Zorrilla, ella vive con su marido y sus hijos.
Ella trabaja en la venta de comidas, de a poco va progresando pero necesita de una ayuda o soporte económico que la ayude a seguir superándose ella misma y a su fasmilia, por eso solicita el apoyo de Kiva para poder comprar víveres y bebidas en mayores cantidades a fin de obtener más ganancias.
Ella como también sus compañeras están muy satisfechas con el apoyo que les está brindando la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva, las señoras están en el ciclo Nº 3 con sus 19 integrantes.
texts.en:
The women of this group are from the community of Maria Auxiliadora in the city of Caacupe, located at 38 km from the regional office of the city.

The leader of the group is Mrs. Limpia Concepcion S. Zorilla. She lives with her husband and children. 

She sells prepared foods and she has been increasing incrementally but she now needs help or financial support to keep improving herself and her family. For this reason she requests support from Kiva to purchase ingredients and drinks in large quantities with the goal of increasing her profits. 

She, as her colleagues, is very happy with the support that they have received from Fundacion Paraguaya (Kiva Field Partner) and Kiva. These women are on their 3rd loan cycle and they are 19 members.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients and drinks

loans.name: Doris

texts.es:
Doris tiene 49 años de edad, es divorciada y reside junto a su hijo en el caserío Toribio Castro del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de pobladores humildes que se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la elaboración de venta de alimentos en un cafetín de un molino de la zona donde vive. Ella prepara alimentos y los ofrece en venta a las personas que vienen a trabajar en la zona, adicionalmente vende golosinas, galletas y bebidas gaseosas. El negocio tiene una antigüedad de 2 años y es de mucha ayuda para su familia, ya que por medio de este se encarga de ayudar al sostenimiento de su economía diaria.

Doris desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de sillas y mesas para renovar las que tiene en su negocio y están deteriorados insumos ya que la demanda por su negocio ha aumentado. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Doris is 49 years old, divorced, and she lives with her son in the community of Toribio Castro in the district of Lambayeque. It is a region of humble inhabitants that are primarily dedicated to agriculture. It is located more than half an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

She prepares foods from a cafeteria at a mill in the region where she lives. She prepares foods and she offers them for sale to the people who come to work in the region. She also sells snacks, cookies, and soft drinks. The business is 2 years old and it is a great source of help for her family. It is through this business that she is able to earn a daily living.

Doris wants to expand her business with the purchase of chairs and tables to replace the ones that she has in her business because they have deteriorated. And she wants to purchase ingredients because her business's demand has increased. For this reason she has approached Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 800 nuevos soles which will help her reach her objectives.

loans.use: to purchase chairs and tables to renovate her business

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es:
El Sr. Oscar V. tiene 37 años de edad, vive en pareja con la Sra. Norma Beatriz, tienen 3 hijos juntos todos en edad escolar y viven en la cuidad de Carapeguá.
Como proviene de una familia humilde y con ganas de salir adelante decidió emprender un pequeño negocio, empezó vendiendo ropas y calzados por la zona urbana de su ciudad, en poco tiempo logró juntar un poco de capital para empezar a comprar más variedad de artículos y llevar a vender por la capital del país, Asunción,  donde ya tiene una buena clientela formada.
Gracias a su trabajo y esfuerzo  pudo comprarse una motocicleta, la cual utiliza para realizar sus ventas y mantener la buena clientela.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías (hamacas, frazadas, sobrecamas, fajas y sábanas) puesto que tiene muchos pedidos de estos productos y desea cumplir con sus consumidores.
texts.en:
Oscar V. is 37 years old and lives with his partner, Norma Beatriz, with whom he has 3 school-aged children.  They live in the city of Carapeguá.  Since he comes from a modest family with a desire to get ahead, he decided to start a small business.  He began selling clothing and shoes throughout the urban areas of the city.  Over a short period of time, he managed to gather some capital to buy a greater variety of merchandise to take to the country’s capital city, Asunción, where he now has a well-established customer base. 

Thanks to his hard work and effort, he was able to buy himself a motorcycle that he uses to make his sales and maintain his good customers.  He requests this loan to buy merchandise (hammocks, blankets, bedspreads, and sheets) as he has many requests for these products and he wants to fulfill his consumers’ needs.

loans.use: to buy bedspreads, sheets, hammocks, etc.

loans.name: Maximo

texts.es:
Máximo tiene 30 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el sector  San Nicolás del distrito de Lambayeque, una zona de pobladores humildes que se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, se encuentra situada a más de media hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Máximo se dedica a la crianza y venta de cerdos en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 5 años, la misma que aprendió de su padre, por tal motivo conoce el rubro a la perfección. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta en los mercados y/o a vecinos de la zona. Adicionalmente cría aves de corral y ganado caprino. Los ingresos que le brindan esta actividad es utilizado para el sostenimiento de la economía de su familia.

Máximo desea adquirir alimento balanceado para sus animales y de esta manera obtener buen peso, incrementando sus ganancias. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Máximo is 30 years old, married, and lives with his family in the San Nicolás sector of the district of Lambayeque.  The residents of the area are modest, and dedicate themselves primarily to agriculture.  It is located more than a half hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Máximo dedicates himself to raising and selling pigs from the rear side of his house.  He has been carrying out this activity for 5 years, having learned the trade from his father, which is why he knows it perfectly.  Once his animals have reached a good level of development, he offers them for sale in the zone’s markets and to neighbors.  Additionally, he raises poultry and goats.  He uses the income from these activities to support his family.

Máximo would like to buy well-balanced feed for his animals so they will grow to ideal weights, which will augment his profits.  For this reason, he has decided to request a loan of 1000 Peruvian soles through Edpyme Alternativa for the first time to help him achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy well-balanced feed for his animals.

loans.name: María Josefa

texts.es:
María Josefa es una madre de familia de 43 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío Taymi del distrito de Tucume. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

María Josefa se dedica  a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde que era joven ayudando a sus padres. María Josefa se dedica desde hace 5 años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, especialmente aves de corral y cerdos, en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

Ella desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
María Josefa is a 43-year old mother who lives with her family in the town of Taymi, located in the Tucume district.  This is an agricultural area located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

María Josefa dedicates herself to work related to agriculture and, from a young age, helped her parents in this type of activity.  For the past 5 years, she has dedicated herself to raising and selling small animals, especially poultry and pigs, in a pen located near her house.  She feeds them natural grains and grasses and, when they have reached an ideal level of development, she offers them to sale to the merchants who frequently visit the zone where she lives.

She would like to buy more animals, as well as balanced feed, in order to expand her business and augment her income.  For this reason, she has decided to request a loan of 2000 Peruvian soles through Edpyme Alternativa to help her reach her goal.

loans.use: to buy more animals and well-balanced feed.

loans.name: Reinerio

texts.es:
El Sr. Reinerio D. es cliente recurrente de Fundación Paraguaya, el mismo es soltero y vive en la ciudad de Luque.
El titular anteriormente era chofer de una parada de taxi ubicada en el centro de Luque, actualmente ha adquirido un nuevo auto para realizar trabajos en forma independiente y desea el préstamo de Kiva para el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo.
