Reinero es una persona muy humilde y trabajadora, sabe y reconoce que el sacrificio dignifica al hombre, por eso no se lamenta por la pobreza y la dureza laboral de algunos días, sino que mira hacia el futuro con optimismo y perseverancia.
Si realiza dicha inversión el titular considera que le dará un mejor ingreso para su vida en particular y para la buena atención a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Sr. Reinerio D. is a longstanding member of Kiva partner Fundación Paraguaya. He is single and lives in the town of Luque. In the past he was a driver at a taxi stand located in the centre of Luque, but now he has his own car and works independently. Reinerio would like a loan from Kiva to maintain and repair his vehicle.

He is a simple, hardworking man who knows and understands that sacrifice gives a man self-respect. For this reason he doesn’t complain about his poverty and the daily grind; instead he looks to the future with optimism and perseverance.

If Reinerio obtains a loan, he will consider it an important addition to his life and to the good service he provides to his customers.

loans.use: to repair his car

loans.name: Humbelina Vicenta

texts.es:
Humbelina es una madre de familia de 46 años de edad que reside junto a sus dos hijas en el  distrito de Chepén. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la Región de La Libertad, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Humbelina se dedica desde hace 8 años a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, especialmente aves de corral, cuyes los cuales los cría en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos y pastos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. 

Ella desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos, asimismo realizar algunas mejoras a su vivienda. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
46-year old Humbelina is mother to two children and lives in the district of Chepén, an agricultural area located in La Libertad region, over an hour from the town of Chiclayo.

For the last eight years Humbelina has raised and then sold young animals, particularly poultry, which she raises in a corral near her house. She feeds them grain and natural grasses, and when they have reached a good size she sells them to merchants who visit the area frequently.

Humbelina wishes to expand her business by buying more animals and nutritious feed. This will provide her with a better income and she will be able to make some improvements to her house. She is seeking a loan of 1000 soles from Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa to help her achieve this objective.

loans.use: to buy more animals and nutritious feed

loans.name: Lizeth Margarita

texts.es:
Lizeth pequeña comerciante, de ropa, ropa interior, cosmético, logrando hace años comercializar sus productos en su casa de habitación, así como en oficinas y clientes del barrio. Es madre de dos hijos, el cual cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo.

Comenzó a vender más, y comprar estilo de ropa con financiamiento que la institución de Afodenic, logro dar atreves del préstamo, siendo el sexto ciclo, lo que para su comercio ha sido de excelente inversión.
Con este nuevo préstamo invertirá en compra de ropa para damas como: faldas, camisas, blúmer, short, cosméticos, así como ropa para caballeros. Partes de estos productos los da al crédito. Lo que espera seguir proyectándose a mejores resultados de economía.
texts.en:
For many years Lizeth has run a small business selling clothing, underwear, and cosmetics from her home as well as to neighbours and people in nearby offices. She has two children; her husband also helps support the family.

With her sixth loan from Kiva partner Afodenic, Lizeth started to sell more items and bought new lines of clothing and that has proved to be a good investment. With this new loan she plans to buy women’s clothing such as skirts, shirts, bloomers, shorts, and cosmetics, as well as men’s clothing. She will let customers have some of these products on credit. Lizeth hopes that this new stock will help her earn more money.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's clothing and cosmetics

loans.name: Angel Adolfo

texts.es:
Ángel tiene 69 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

El se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales menores, ganado ovino y caprino, los cuales cría en un ambiente cerca a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona, además recorre los diferentes caseríos cercanos a su domicilio. Con los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad se encarga de sacar adelante a su familia ya que esta actividad la realiza hace 30 años y cuenta con experiencia en este rubro y clientela fidelizada.

Ángel desea ampliar su negocio comprando más animales de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas obteniendo a menor precio en la ciudad de Chiclayo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Ángel is 69 years old, married, and lives together with his family in Olmos district, a rural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located in Lambayeque province, more than one and half hours from the city of Chiclayo.

Ángel's business is raising and selling animals: sheep and goats.  He raises them in an area near his home and when they have reached a good level of development he offers them for sale to the general public and the traders who usually visit his area.  He also travels to neighboring villages to sell.  Ángel uses the income from this activity to get his family ahead in life.  He has been in the business for 30 years.  He has both experience and a loyal customer base.

Ángel would like to expand his business by purchasing more animals so that he can increase his sales and obtain his animals for a lower price in the city of Chiclayo.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more animals to increase his business

loans.name: Jeny Rossana

texts.es: La señora Jenny tiene 39 años es madre soltera tiene 3 hijos que están en edad escolar, ella vende ropa para damas caballeros y niños  desde el año 2008, se amino a realizar esta actividad para dedicarle mas tiempo a sus hijos, antes trabajaba en un fundo como obrera de campo, con ese dinero ahorrado invirtió en el negocio de venta de ropa y ahora se dedica a esa actividad en forma diaria su  ingresos semanales es de s/ 500, los desafíos que enfrenta es que vive en casa de un familiar por que no tiene casa propia, su sueño en el futuro es hacer crecer su negocio, y además adquirir una vivienda para vivir con sus hijos, el dinero lo invertirá en compra mercadería por cambio d estación como chompas pantalones cafarenas entre otras cosas, Jenny esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que se le esta brindando.
texts.en:
Jenny is 39 years old.  She is a single mother and has three school-age children.  Her business is selling women's, men's and children's clothes.  She has been doing this since 2008.

Jenny decided to start working in this business activity so that she could devote more time to her children.  She used to work on a large farm as a field laborer but she saved up some money which she then invested in this clothes-selling business.  She now sells clothes every day.  Her weekly income is 500 Peruvian soles.

The challenge that Jenny faces is that she lives in a family member's home because she does not own her own home.  Her dream for the future is to grow her business and buy a house to live in with her children.  She will invest her loan money in buying merchandise for the change of season.  She will buy sweaters, pants, turtlenecks (polo necks), etc.  Jenny is very grateful for the support that she is being given.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for the new season such as sweaters, pants, etc.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza mujer trabajadora, que durante varios años se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos, chinelas de dama y caballeros. El cual tiene nueve años de haber establecido su negocio, iniciando con pequeñas compras de mercadería, hoy en día en Afodenic sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad en sus mercaderías con precios más competitivos.
Esperanza ha venido mejorando la infraestructura de su vivienda poco a poco con ayuda de su esposo, siendo de pocos recursos económicos. Es por eso tiene mucha dedicación a su pequeño negocio ya que logra apoyar a su familia.
Comprara con su nuevo financiamiento, zapatos de dama y caballeros, sandalias, chinelas estilo veranera, así como encargos que tiene de sus clientas. Siendo el objetivo aumentar la inversión.
texts.en:
Esperanza is a hard-working woman who has been selling men's and women's clothes, shoes and thongs (flip flops) for several years.  She set up her business nine years ago and started out making small purchases of merchandise.  Today, with the help of Afodenic, her sales levels have increased and she offers a greater variety of merchandise at competitive prices.

Esperanza has been gradually improving the infrastructure of her home with her husband's help as they have limited financial resources.  She is very committed to her small business as it helps her to support her family.

Esperanza will use her new loan to buy men's and women's shoes, sandals and summer thongs (flip flops).  She will also fill some orders that her customers have made.  Her goal is to increase her investment.

loans.use: to buy men's and women's shoes and a variety of summer sandals, in order to increase her sales

loans.name: María Elva

texts.es:
La Sra. María Elva es soltera, tiene  cinco  hijos, de los cuales  dos están en edad escolar y tres son mayores de edad que viven todavía con ella.
María se dedica a la venta de ropas, en forma ambulante, la misma actividad le genera un buen ingreso.
Con la ayuda de sus hijos están saliendo adelante, con mucho sacrificio y dedicación, ya que sólo ellos mismos son el poyo familiar y económico que necesitan.
Hoy día ella es una microempresaria exitosa con  mucha  clientela, debido a su buen trato.
Ha demostrado ser una persona responsable y honesta en sus compromisos por lo que se anima a solicitar todo el apoyo necesario para mejorar sus mercaderías, desea invertir el crédito en la compra de abrigos y pantalones.
texts.en:
María Elva is single and has five children.  Two of her children are in school and three are grown up but still live with her.

María sells clothes in an itinerant manner.  This makes her a good income.

With the help of her children, María's family is getting ahead in life.  They make a lot of sacrifice and commitment as they themselves are their only source of financial support.

María is a successful small businesswoman who has a lot of customers because of her good customer service.  She has proven herself to be a responsible and honest person and she is requesting all the support she needs in order to improve her merchandise.  She would like to invest her loan in buying coats and pants.

loans.use: to buy coats and pants

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Rosa Amelia le esta haciendo falta los acabados del exterior con es pintar y poner una losa de concreto al frente de la casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar el material y pagar a la persona que se encargara de realizar la mejora que su casa esta necesitando.
Plana pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene su esposo el señor Carlos de su trabajo en una compañía de trasportes como chofer de un camión de carga. 
Desean que sus dos hijos tengan un patrimonio seguro y en mejores condiciones
texts.en: Rosa Amelia's house needs some finishing touches making to the outside such as painting and laying a concrete slab out front.  She is requesting a loan so that she can buy the material and pay the person who will carry out the improvements that her house needs.  She plans to repay her loan with some of the income that her husband Carlos makes from his job working as a truck driver for a transport company.  Rosa and her husband want their children to have a secure patrimony which is in better condition.

loans.use: to make some finishing touches to the outside of her home and to pay somebody to carry out the work

loans.name: Esperanza Group

texts.es:
Este comité se formó en el Barrio Empalado Ari de la  Ciudad de Caaguazú, la Sra. Ana Beatriz A. participaba de un grupo de mujeres como comisión vecinal y se enteró por medio de las promociones, que la Fundación Paraguaya otorgaba pequeños préstamos para mujeres, y fue así con mucho entusiasmo decidieron  participar del programa, son 21  señoras trabajadoras que quieren seguir progresando.
La sra. Cristina A. se dedica a la venta de verduras en un puesto propio desde hace mucho tiempo, es un trabajo sacrificado pero ella desea superarse y ayudarle a su familia por eso se esfuerza cada día sin tener en cuenta el cansancio o el excesivo sacrificio.
Solicitó el crédito para poder comprar mayor cantidad de verduras de modo que pueda adquirir a costos más bajos y obtener un margen de ganancia más amplio.
texts.en:
This committee was established in Empalado Ari neighborhood, in the city of Caaguazú.  Ana Beatriz A. used to take part in a women's neighborhood committee.  She found out, through Fundación Paraguaya's promotion work, that they awarded small loans to women.  With a lot of enthusiasm, she and her group decided to take part in the program.  The group has 21 hard-working members who would all like to continue making progress.

Cristina A. has been selling vegetables from a stall that she owns for a long time.  It is hard work but she would like to improve herself and help her family.  For this reason, she works hard every day without paying attention to how tired she is or the sacrifices that she is making.

Cristina requested this loan so that she could buy a larger quantity of vegetables.  This will allow her to acquire her products at a lower cost and make a better profit margin.

loans.use: to buy vegetables (onions, tomatoes, cassava, greens, etc.)

loans.name: Cipriano

texts.es:
El señor Cipriano tiene 74 años de edad, está casado con la señora Arminda González de 70 años de edad, tienen 5 hijos todos mayores de edad e independientes a ellos.
Don Cipriano emigró de la ciudad de Villeta hace muchos años a la ciudad de Itá donde abrió una despensa y una chipería, gracias a esas actividades logró costear los estudios de sus hijos.
El mismo manifiesta que lo consiguió con mucho sacrificio, actualmente sigue funcionando su despensa, allí surte a sus vecinos y a ocasionales clientes de arroz, azúcar, yerba, bebidas en general y otras mercaderías, per como desea mejorar su sotck de productos solicita el préstamo para la compra de dichos insumos, teniedo en cuenta que también opera con la Fundación Paraguaya desde el año 2.004 en forma excelente.
texts.en:
Cipriano is 74 years old and married to Arminda González who is 70.  They have five children who are all grown up and live independently.

Cipriano emigrated from the city of Villeta to the city of Itá many years ago.  He opened a grocery store and a small eatery.  Thanks to these business activities, he managed to pay for his children's studies.  He tells us that he managed this with a lot of sacrifice.

Cipriano continues to run his grocery store where he provides his neighbors and other customers with rice, sugar, yerba mate, drinks and other merchandise.  He would like to improve his stock and so requested a loan to buy the products he needs.  He has been working with Fundación Paraguaya since 2004 and has an excellent record.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, drinks, vegetables, cereals, sugar, condiments, etc.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria tiene ya más de un año dedicándose a la venta de ropa nueva y usada a fuera de su vivienda.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía y no cuenta con el dinero necesario para invertir. Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo.
Su propósito es tener ropa de buena calidad, para toda la familia, diferentes estilos y así poder tener más clientes y que la puedan recomendar con sus amigos y conocidos. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias del negocio, ya que su esposo Gerardo se encargara de los gastos familiares con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Ana Maria has been selling new and used clothing from outside her home for more than one year.  Her business needs a greater variety of merchandise but she doesn't have the money she needs to invest.  This is why she is requesting a loan.

Ana Maria's goal is to have good-quality clothes for all the family, in different styles, and thereby attract more customers who will recommend her to their friends and acquaintances.  She plans to make her loan repayments from the profits she makes in her business since her husband Gerardo will take care of their family expenses with the income he makes from his job.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: David

texts.es: David es chofer, el crédito lo necesita para la compra de un motor nuevo para su movilidad de transporte de pasajeros; con los ingresos que obtiene cubren los gastos de su familia. Vive en la casa propia ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La P.. Es casado y tiene cuatro hijos. El cliente se encuentra muy satisfecho con los créditos que se le otorgaron y pudo mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en: David is a driver. He needs this loan to purchase a new engine for his passenger transport business.  He covers his family’s expenses with the income he earns through this business.  He owns a home in the neighborhood of Tembladerani in the city of La P..  He is married and has four children.  David is very satisfied with the loans that have been granted to him, as they have helped him to improve his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a new engine for his passenger transport business

loans.name: Kuña Katupyry Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de las Sras. Rebeca R. y Maria Vidalia S., quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más del  Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras, invitaron a sus amigas y compañeras del barrio y decidieron sumarse al trabajo grupal para salir adelante y así mejorar su estilo de vida, son 18 (Diez y ocho) mujeres trabajadoras y humildes que deben ganarse el sustento todos los días.
La sra. Maria Vicia se dedica a la produccion y venta de queso, y en algunas ocasiones vende también leche, ella es una mujer muy esmerada en su labor, es destacada por esa caracteristica por todos los que la conocen, su familia lucha contra la pobreza cada día y ella desea con fe poder salir de esa situacion por ello trabaja arduamente.
Solicita el préstamo para adquirir leche y herramientas para la produccion de queso, confia plenamente en que los inversionistas van a apoyarla, tanto a ella como a su grupo.
texts.en:
This committee was formed by Rebeca R. and Maria Vidalia S..  They approached the Fundación Paraguaya office to get involved in the Women Entrepreneurs Program.  They invited their friends and neighbors and decided to work together to get ahead and improve their quality of life.  There are 18 humble, working women in this group that must earn a living each day. 

Maria Vicia is dedicated to the production and sale of cheese. On some occasions she also sells milk.  She is known for being very careful with her work.  Her family fights against poverty every day and she has faith she will overcome this situation by working hard.  Maria is requesting this loan to buy more milk and tools for producing cheese.  She has faith that the investors will support both her and her group.

loans.use: to buy milk and tools for the production of cheese

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: La Señora Nelly trabaja como estilista en un pequeño salón de belleza que ella tiene; el crédito lo necesita para la compra de insumos como maquillaje, cremas, ruleros, spray para cabello, etc. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz;  es casada, tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Nelly works as a stylist in a small beauty salon that she owns.  She needs this loan to buy supplies such as makeup, creams, rollers, hair spray, etc.  She lives in her own home which is located in Achachicala district, in the city of La Paz.  She is married and has one child.  This is the first time that she has received a loan from IMPRO.

loans.use: to buy supplies such as makeup, creams, sprays and rollers for her beauty salon

loans.name: Fausto

texts.es: El señor Fausto es chofer, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de un sistema de frenos y el cambio de llantas, pues esta actividad de transporte de pasajeros que realiza cubre los gastos que tiene. Vive en casa de su madre ubicada en la zona Las Delicias  de la ciudad De La Paz, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en: Fausto is a driver.  He requires a loan to buy a brake system and new tires for his vehicle as it is through his passenger transport business that he covers his expenses.  Fausto lives in his mother's home which is located in the Las Delicias neighborhood, in the city of La Paz.  He is married and has two children.  This is the first time that he has worked with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy brakes and new tires for his vehicle

loans.name: Rossi

texts.es: La señora Rossi es comerciante de condimentos y especies al por mayor repartiendo por distintos mercados, con los ingresos que obtienen se mantienen. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de mas especies como, orégano, aji, comino, pimienta, etc. Vive en anticretico ubicada en la zona de Alto San Pedro de la ciudad de La Paz, es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos. La cliente se encuentra muy contenta con los créditos que obtuvo ya que le ayudo a mejorar la calidad e vida de su familia, pues esta es la quinta vez que solicita un crédito de IMPRO y la segunda que se canaliza a través de Kiva.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rossi is a condiment and spice wholesaler who sells throughout different markets.  She supports her family with her income.  She plans to use the loan to buy more spices such as oregano, red pepper, cumin, pepper, etc.  

She lives in rental property in the Alto San Pedro area in the city of La Paz.  She is divorced and has four children.  This is her fifth loan through IMPRO and second through KIVA.  She is very satisfied with how the loans have helped her and her family improve their lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy oregano, red pepper, cumin, pepper and other spices to sell in the city markets

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: La señora Juana se dedica a la venta de casas; su esposo es chofer interdepartamental. Con el dinero del préstamo hará la refacción de habitaciones un par de habitaciones pues vive en casa propia, ubicada en la zona Tembladerani de La Paz; es casada y tiene dos hijos. Es la primera vez que tiene un préstamo en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Mrs. Juana sells real estate and her husband is an interdepartmental driver. They have two children. She plans to use the loan to renovate two rooms in her home which is located in the Tembladerani area of La Paz.  

This is her first loan through IMPRO.

loans.use: To renovate two rooms in order to live more comfortably

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys es una madre de familia de 47 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío Tranca Sasape del distrito de Mórrope. Un distrito agrícola que se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo

Gladys se a la crianza de animales menores, especialmente aves de corral, pavos y cerdos, en un corral situado cerca a su domicilio. Ella los alimenta de granos naturales, cuando ya han alcanzado un buen nivel de desarrollo los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que frecuentemente visitan la zona en donde reside. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 6 años por eso cuenta con clientela fidelizada.

Ella desea adquirir más animales y alimento balanceado para ampliar su negocio y percibir mayores ingresos. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Gladys is a 47-year-old mother who lives with her famly in the Tranca Sasape rural area in Mórrope.  This is an agricultural district located in the province of Lambayeque, over an hour from the city of Chiclayo.

Gladys raises small animals, especially chicken, turkey and pigs, in a farmyard near her home.  She feeds them natural grain and when they are fully developed sells them to merchants who visit the area.  She has been in the business for six years and has a loyal customer base.

She wants to buy more animals and balanced feed to expand business and increase income.  She decided to request a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN from Edpyme Alternativa in order to reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy more animals and balanced feed

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina is 45 years old and has five children, 3 of whom are still studying and living at home. She owns a restaurant near a local main bus stop in Ayacucho. 

Paulina will be using her loan of 1,600 PEN to purchase ingredients for food preparation such as rice, sugar, and meat. She has owned her restaurant for 12 years, and has been a member of FINCA Peru for 10 years now. She appreciates the help that FINCA Peru provides for her, and the obligatory plan for savings.

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for food preparation.

loans.name: Rosmery  Paola

texts.es:
Rosmery tiene 26 años de edad, es casada y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en general desde hace 4 años. Ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y se vale de ella para ayudar al mantenimiento de su economía diaria.

Rosmery desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio aprovechando los costos bajos que le permitan incrementar sus ganancias, así también desea comprar los útiles escolares de su menor hijo. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo.
texts.en:
Rosmery is 26 years old, married and lives with her family in the district of Olmos, a highly commercial agricultural area located in the province of Lambayeque, over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She has been selling clothing for four years.  She sells her products on credit or for cash with her main customers being neighbors and acquaintances.  The business has been of great economic help to the family and helps cover daily household expenses.

Rosmery wants to buy more merchandise to expand business and take advantage of the low costs so she can increase her earings and buy school supplies for her youngest child.  She decided to request a loan in the amount of 2,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa to help her reach her goal.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es:
Eusebio tiene 45  años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su esposa y sus dos hijos  en el caserío Chacupe Alto, una zona rural que tiene como actividad principal a la agricultura y que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de La Victoria, a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de 15 años, el siembra en un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta, ya que heredo de sus padres.  Eusebio desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Eusebio is 45 years old, married and lives with his wife and two children in the Chacupe Alto rural area, which is mainly agricultural and located in the district of La Victoria, twenty mintues from the city of Chiclayo.

He has been involved in agriculture-related jobs for over 15 years and has a small patch of cropland that he inherited from his parents.  Eusebio wants to buy fertilizer for maintenance of his crops with the hopes of obtaining a good harvest.  He decided to request a loan in the amount of 1,000 PEN through Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy crop fertilizer

loans.name: Triumphant Friends Group

texts.es: La alcancía Comunal “Amigos triunfadores” está conformada por nueve personas emprendedoras, se dedican al comercio y servicio en su comunidad. Kandy es la presidenta electa y a sus 37 años y con una pequeña niña a su cargo se desenvuelve  como asistenta D. salud,  trabaja para un área D. salud realizando visitas a pacientes con TBC y VIH, a la vez se dedica a vender productos cosméticos D. diversas compañías hace 20 años. Con su esfuerzo D. cada día ha logrado mantener estable a su niña D. 09 años D. edad pues padece D. una enfermedad y ha mejorado su calidad D. vida. El dinero D. préstamo será invertido en comprar cremas, perfumes para ampliar su stock. Su sueño es ver crecer a su hija y poder abrir una perfumería en casa D. sus padres ya que cuenta aun con el apoyo D. ellos. Kandy y sus socios D. la Alcom “Amigos Triunfadores” empiezan  en el programa incentivados por el afán D. ahorro. El nombre D. sus grupo lo dice todo se han reunido para triunfar. Podemos verles en la foto luego D. acto D. desembolso, la Sra. Esther no está por motivo D. una emergencia en su casa. Pero juramento como vocal. Los socios están optimistas y agradecidos por el préstamo recibido.
texts.en:
The communal bank named "Triumphant Friends" is maD. up of nine enterprising individuals. They  are dedicated to commerce and to providing services in their community. Kandy is the elected leader of the group. She is 37 years of age and she has little girl in her care. She is a health  
care assistant. She works in a field of health care where she pays visits to patients with tuberculosis and HIV. She has also sold cosmetics of various brand names for the past 20 years. With her daily work she has been able to support her 9-year old daughter who suffers from an illness, and she has improved the quality of their life. The funds from this loan will be invested in the purchase of skin lotions and perfumes to supplement her stock. Her dream is to see her daughter grow up and to be able to open a perfume store in her parents' house, seeing as she has their support. Kandy and her colleagues of the communal bank "Triumphant Friends" have started an incentive program with the goal of saving money. The name of their group says it all. They have come together to be triumphant. The photo shows them when they are receiving their loans. Esther is not in the photo because she has a personal emergency but she has maD. a verbal promise. The members are optimists and they are thankful for the loan they have received.

loans.use: to purchase skin lotions and perfumes

loans.name: Santos Angela

texts.es:
Santos tiene 52 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a su hijo en el caserío Manuel Seoane que está ubicado a 20 km D. la zona rural D. la localidad D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola que se encuentra situado en la región Piura, a más D. cuatro horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

Ella se dedica a la crianza D. ganado ovino y D. cerdos, los cuales cría en un  ambiente cercano a su domicilio, cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen nivel D. desarrollo los ofrece en venta al público en general y a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con los ingresos que percibe D. esta actividad se encargan D. sacar adelante a su familia. Esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 5 años por ello cuenta con clientela fidelizada.

Santos desea comprar  alimento balanceado para su ganado D. modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas permitiéndole vender a un buen precio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Santos is 52 years old.  She is married and lives together with her husband and son in the village of Manuel Seoane which is located 20km from the rural area of TambogranD., an agricultural district in Piura region which is more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Santos' business is raising sheep and pigs.  She raises her animals near her home and when they have reached a good level of development she offers them for sale to the general public and the traders who usually visit her area.  She uses the income from her business to get her family ahead in life.  She has been in this business for five years and has a loyal customer base.

Santos would like to buy balanced feed for her animals so that she can increase her sales and sell her animals for a good price.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,500 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to install a corrugated metal roof and do some finishing work

loans.name: Virgen Del Carmen Group

texts.es: Marisol participa en la Alcancía Comunal “Virgen del Carmen “que está conformada por siete integrantes, ella participa desD. hace 3años y su devoción por la virgen del Carmen la une cada vez. Ahora está ejerciendo el cargo D. tesorera. Es madre D. 03 menores, en edad escolar y a sus 38 años ha logrado aperturar una pequeña bodega en su casa D. nombre “Señor D. Muruhuay”, ya tiene 12 años en el rubro y  nos cuenta que empezó en casa D. su suegra y viendo ganancias no lo dudo y se estableció además realiza ventas D. productos cosméticos D. diferentes compañías y en este giro ya tiene 5 años. Los gastos D. su casa los asume su conviviente y ella apoya con los gastos D. movilidad y víveres para la alimentación D. su familia. Marisol desea adquirir algún terreno para construir y poder alquilar y así tener otros ingresos. El préstamo será invertido  para comprar arroz, azúcar, menestras y bebidas para su bodega. Nuestras socias D. la Alcancia Virgen del Carmen son puntúales y responsables en cada crédito obtenido, ellas están agradecidas por su ayuda incondicional.
texts.en:
Marisol is part of the communal bank  "Virgen del Carmen" which is maD. up of 7 members. She has participated for 3 years and their love for the Virgen del Carmen unites them every time. Now she is acting as treasurer. 

She is a mother of 3 school-aged children, 38 years old and has opened a small grocery store by the name of "Señor D. Muruhuay”. She now has 12 years in this line of work and she tells us that she started in the house of her mother-in-law, and since she was seeing profits she didn't doubt it and established herself. In addition, she sells cosmetic products from different companies and has been doing this for 5 years. Her partner covers their cost of living and she helps with the costs of mobility and food for the family.

Marisol wants to acquire some land to build on and be able to rent for extra income. The loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, beans and drinks for her grocery store. Our partners at the Virgen del Carmen bank are punctual and responsible on every loan they get. They are very grateful for the unconditional support.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans and drinks

loans.name: Mabel

texts.es:
Mabel tiene 30 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a la venta de prendas de vestir en general. Ella ofrece estos productos tanto al crédito como al contado y los ofrece principalmente entre sus vecinos y conocidos. Esta actividad es de mucha ayuda para la economía de su familia y se vale de ella para ayudar al mantenimiento de su economía diaria.

Mabel desea adquirir más prendas de vestir para ampliar su negocio. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 600 nuevos soles que le ayuden a realizar su objetivo. Mabel  es una joven bastante trabajadora y empeñosa, las personas que le conocen admiran sus ganas de salir adelante y progresar.
texts.en:
Mabel, 30, is single living with her family in Olmos District, a farming area with quite a bit of commercial activity located in Lambayeque Province over an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells assorted items of clothing both for cash and on credit primarily to her neighbors and acquaintances.  This activity is of great economic help for her family and she uses it to help cover daily expenses.

Mabel would like to acquire more articles of clothing to expand her business.  Because of this she’s thought it convenient to request a 600 new sol loan from Edpyme Alternativa that will help her reach this goal.  Mabel is a very hard working, enterprising young woman.  People who know her admire her drive to get ahead and make progress.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy material and tools for her business

loans.name: Belen Group

texts.es: El banco comunal Belen, esta en el 14 ciclo. Las socias del banco se dedican a L. venta D. cereales, animales menores, venta D. abarrotes, venta D. quesos, tejido D. chompas, y a L. costura. L. presidenta para este ciclo es Juana, tiene 53 anos, es casada, con 4 hijos D. (15, 14,y mellisos D. 11 anos). Es feriante solicita un credito D. S/. 1 050.00. El credito que solicita lo invertira en L. compra D. cereales. Juana viaja a L. feria D. Seccelambras los dias jueves ahi compra los cereales y los venD. en Ayacucho a sus caceras a veces los venD. elL. misma en su puesto. Los dias que no viaja a L. ferias venD. cereales, papas, choclos, arvejas o verduras D. temporada en el mercadillo cerca al cementerio. Los dias domingos venD. en L. feria D. San Juan Bautista. Ingreso a FINCA Peru, por L. invitacion D. L. promotora, le gusta por L. facilidad en los creditos y pueD. ahorrar, aprenD. en las capacitaciones. Su sueno es que sus hijos sean profesionales que tengan mejores oportunidades que elL. y que su negocio siga prosperando.
texts.en:
The Belén communal bank is in its 14th cycle.   The bank members sell cereals, small farm animals, groceries, cheese; some weave sweaters and are seamstresses.

The group President is Juana, 53.  She’s married and has four children (15, 14 and 11 year old twins).  She’s a merchant and is asking for a 1050 sol loan to buy cereals.  Juana travels to the Seccelambras market Thursdays to buy the cereals there that she then sells to housewives in Ayacucho.  Sometimes she sells them herself in her stand.  On days she doesn’t travel to the markets, she sells cereals, potatoes, dehydrated potatoes, peas or seasonal vegetables in the little market near the cemetery.  On Sundays she sells at the San Juan Bautista market.

She joined FINCA Peru thanks to an invitation from a promoter.  She likes it because of the ease in getting loans and because she can save; she also likes learning at the training sessions.  Her dream is that her children become professionals and that her business continues to make progress.

loans.use: to buy cereals.

loans.name: Darwin Franco

texts.es:
Darwin tiene 30 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Jayanca. Una zona agrícola, donde se ubican empresas industriales, que se ubica a una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Darwin se dedica al rubro de construcción como maestro de obras (persona que se dedica  a la construcción de viviendas o edificios teniendo a su cargo a varias personas que realizan esta actividad), esta actividad la realiza desde hace 8 años por tal motivo conoce a la perfección este rubro, contando con clientela establecida. 

El desea ampliar su negocio, adquiriendo herramientas que le permitan realizar con más facilidad su trabajo, recibiendo mayores ingresos, lo que le permitirá realizar algunas mejoras en su vivienda de modo que su familia pueda vivir en mejores condiciones. Por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1200 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Darwin, 30, lives with his family in Jayanca District, a farming zone where industrial firms are located.  It is located an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Darwin is a Master Builder (a person who builds houses or buildings who supervises several people who do this kind of work).  He’s been in this line of work for 8 years so knows it to perfection and has an established customer base.

He wants to expand the business acquiring tools that will make it possible for him to do the work more easily, earning better income which will permit him to do some home improvements so that his family can live under better conditions.  Because of this, he’s thought it wise to request his first, 1200 new sol, loan from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to acquire work tools.

loans.name: Noelia

texts.es:
La señora Noelia tiene ya mas de dos años dedicándose a la fotografía este negocio es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia, ya que es madre soltera y tiene dos hijos de mediana edad bajo su responsabilidad y a quienes  les quieres dar el estudio necesario para su futuro y que tenga una mejor vida económico. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar un equipo de impresión más moderna y que tenga la impresión fotográfica de mejor calidad ya que desea darles a sus clientes un buen servicio y así la puedan recomendar con sus amigos y familiares. 
Planea pagar el crédito con las ganancias que obtendrá de su negocio ya que teniendo el nuevo equipo tendrá mas trabajo y ingreso al negocio.
texts.en:
Noelia has been doing photography for over two years now; this business is her source of income for family support because she’s a single mother with two preteen children still in her care for whom she wants to provide schooling necessary for their future and so that she can have a better economic life.

She is asking for a loan to buy more modern printing equipment so that the photographic images will be of better quality because she wants to provide a good service to her customers so that they will recommend her to their friends and family members.

She plans to repay the loan with profits obtained from her business since having the new equipment will lead to more work and income in the business.

loans.use: to buy a photocopier.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Rosa Elvira

texts.es:
Rosa  tiene 26  años de edad, es casada y reside junto familia en el sector Las Dunas que se encuentra a 3 minutos del distrito de  Lambayeque, se encuentra situada a más de 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a a la venta de productos de belleza por catálogo, ella vende estos productos entre sus vecinos y amistades, diariamente se esfuerza por captar más clientes ya que mientras más pedidos realice la empresa que le provee de productos le otorga mayores ingresos. El negocio le ayuda a solventar sus gastos personales y a apoyar a su familia  en el sostenimiento de la economía de su hogar.

Rosa  desea ampliar su negocio con la instalación de un puesto de venta de productos cosméticos en su domicilio, así sus clientes tendrán productos al alcance de la mano y no tendrán que esperar a fin de mes que es cuando llega el pedido, para ello necesita adquirir más productos y para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles y de esta manera mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa, 26, is married living with her family in the Las Dunas sector which is located three minutes from Lambayeque District and over 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells catalogue beauty products among her neighbors and friends.  Every day she strives to acquire more customers because the more orders she places the more income she earns from the firm supplying the products.  The business helps her cover her personal expenses and to support her family and meet household expenses.

Rosa wants to expand her business setting up a stand to sell her cosmetics at home.  This way her customers will have products at hand and won’t have to wait until the end of the month which is when the orders arrive.  To do so, she needs to acquire more products so she’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1000 new sol loan to do so and as a result improve her quality of life too.

loans.use: to buy beauty products.

In 2010, Amparo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Amparo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Amparo is requesting a new loan of 9000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods. This will be the 5th loan taken out by Amparo from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods & junk foods.

loans.name: Kertha Bakti Group

texts.en:
Ni Luh T. and all members of the Kertha Bakti group continue taking out loans for their third period. For this loan,  two members could not attend the meeting because of some reasons. A person on behalf of Ni Nengah W. who is on Sumbawa and one person is in the photo on behalf of Ni Ketut W. who was sick. 

Ni Luh T. is getting a loan Rp.1,500,000. This loan is now used to buy three piglets. Currently the price of piglets is very expensive; one piglet costs Rp. 400,000. Ni Luh T. spent Rp. 1,200,000 for piglets and she is paying for the feed from the profit on  earlier sales. Every month she spends Rp. 500,000 for food, water, electricity and for her children.

loans.use: To buy three piglets.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita S. is from the village of Minsapinit, Gingoog City. She is 57 years old. Teresita is widowed and has 3 adult children. To make a living, Teresita owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling flowers like roses & babies breath in the local community. Teresita has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 7000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Teresita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Teresita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional flowers & for working capital. Teresita is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional stocks of flowers. This will be the 4th loan taken out by Teresita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory of flowers.

loans.name: Lenita

texts.en:
Lenita D. T. is from the village of Damayuhan, Gingoog City. She is 38 years old. Lenita is married and has 5 school-aged children. To make a living, Lenita owns & operates a specialized retail store, selling seafood products, including fish like kitob & bangse, in the local community. Lenita has been engaged in her business for over 10 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2007, Lenita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lenita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 13000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional fish & for working capital. Lenita is requesting a new loan of 13000 PHP which will again be used to purchase additional fish, like sardines & milk fish. This will be the 10th loan taken out by Lenita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish, like sardines & milk fish.

loans.name: Talat's Group

texts.en:
Talat is 40 years old, married to F. M. and lives in a small city in Pakistan called Chichawatni. She resides in a three-room brick house with her husband and four children: two boys and two girls. Three of them are enrolled in a local school while youngest one has not started attending school yet.  Talat is a working woman as well as a housewife. She manages her household responsibilities and takes care of her children. She also sells embroidered clothes to her neighborhood clients. She purchases them from a city called Multan. The earned profits help her pay school fees for her children and utilities expenses.
 
Her husband is a fruit vendor who operates a shop in the market. He believes in quality and provides fresh seasonal fruits for his clients to purchase.Talat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband, who will invest that money in his business. Through the loan, he will purchase fresh seasonal fruits that will help him attract more customers and make more profit. Talat is hopeful that her husband’s business will be expanded by making positive use of the loan. He has been doing this business for the past 15 years and Talat has full confidence in him. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Talat.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Erkingul's Group

texts.en: Erkingul A., 37, is the leader of this group. The story of this entrepreneur started when she married Kanybek. Erkingul always thought that Kanybek’s hobby of constructing small items of furniture could be turned into a profitable business if managed properly and funded wisely. Erkingul proposed a business plan with a thorough description of resources needed for the business to start up. The main resource was Kanybek’s ideas and creativity. Starting with small wood items such as chairs, tables and window frames, Kanybek deepened into constructing doors, counters and cabinets. He even experimented with new raw materials for constructing monuments. The circle of clients gradually became wider and the orders reached 20,000 soms. The initial capital was only 1,500 soms, and the monthly income reached 19,000 soms. It allowed the couple to buy an automobile, make major furnishings of the house and recently, they started building a small shop by their house. The requested loan will be spent on a purchase of required raw materials for new construction of pieces. Erkingul believes that everything done will be in the name of her 13-year-old daughter. Where Did This Loan Come From? This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused microfinance institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple "P" bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only microfinance institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials

loans.name: Ainabubu Abdykerimova's Group

texts.en:
Ainabubu A., 63, is the leader of this group. Ainabubu is a typical senior citizen in the town of Bokonbaevo. She and her husband have lived a long life of hard labor in farming during a changing national political and economic situation, which led to changes in agriculture too. At this moment both of them are pensioners, but still enjoy farming and rely on it financially. Ainabubu is getting ready for spring field work and has good expectations for the upcoming season. Ainabubu’s son also helps in taking care of the land and gives advice about effective land cultivation and watering. The business is 15 years old and generates 4,000 KGS monthly. Ainabubu hopes to use the loan provided by Kiva lenders in order to purchase seeds for spring field work.

Where did this loan come from?
This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance, a young and ambitious socially-focused MFI in Kyrgyzstan. Mol Bulak Finance is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development on the basis of the 3-Ps concept: People (building human capital and taking care of its customers and society as well), Profit (to be profitable in order to grow further), and the Planet (taking care of the environment). It is also the only MFI in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. To learn more about Mol Bulak and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135.
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team – Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – at www.kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from the Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from Mol Bulak staff.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of seeds

loans.name: Anwer's Group

texts.en:
Anwer lives in a small city in Pakistan called Chichawatni, which is famous for its agricultural industry. She is 46 years old and a mother of a 15-year-old son who operates a fruit-selling business. He sells fruits on a four-wheeled cart by visiting different areas of the city and financially contributing to the family. Anwer lives in a three-room brick house with her family. She came here after her marriage to B. A.. Her husband is also involved in the fruit-selling business.  He also sells fruit on a four-wheeled cart by visiting different areas of the city. Anwer herself stays at home and does her household responsibilities. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband's business. With the loan, he will buy fresh seasonal fruits for his business to increase his sales and profits. Anwer is hopeful that her husband will be able to improve his business conditions with the loan.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Anwer.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new items to expand product offering

loans.name: Erdenedelger

texts.en: Erdenedelger is 38 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Kherlen province, one of Mongolia's largest provinces. She and her family live in a caravan on their land. Her three children all attend a local secondary school. Erdenedelger operates a fruit and vegetable retail business. She purchases fruit and vegetables from the Narantuul and Bars markets, the two largest markets in Ulaanbaatar, and sells them to people for a profit. Her business is doing very well. Erdenedelger has good communication skills and her business is very important to her. She has many plans for the future, and says, “My aim is to create my own shop by working hard and stabilizing my current business.” She is applying for a loan for 900,000 MNT to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesales prices to resell to her many customers.

loans.use: to buy fruit and vegetables at wholesales prices to resell

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
José tiene 65 años de edad. Vive con su esposa en Jayanca, un distrito agrícola del departamento de Lambayeque, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo en el norte de Peru.

José es maestro de obra de construcción desde hace 08 años, un tiempo que le ha permitido a la fecha conocer a la perfección el rubro. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Los ingresos que percibe le permite ayudar con el sostenimiento de su familia y darle sobre todo una mejor calidad de vida a su esposa.

Actualmente, su casa se encuentra en un estado deteriorado. Con su prestamo, desea hacer arreglos en su vivienda, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
José, 65, lives with his wife in Jayanca, a farming district in Lambayeque Department located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo in northern Peru.

José has been a Master Builder for the last 8 years, time which has made it possible for him to learn the occupation to perfection.  He has an established customer base in the zone.  Income he earns makes it possible for him to support his family and, above all, provide his wife with a better quality of life.

At present, his house is a bit deteriorated.  He wants to use the loan to do some home repairs so has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 2000 new sol loan to do so.

loans.use: to do some home improvements.

loans.name: Magali Haydee

texts.es:
Magali tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene 1 hijo. Vive en casa propia con su familia en el Distrito de Tambogrande – Piura, a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito, pero aún así cuenta con el servicio de luz eléctrica.

Magali se dedica a la crianza y venta de ovejas, chanchos y aves de corral. Cuenta a la fecha con clientela ya establecida en la zona y tiene 2 años desarrollando su negocio. Cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos.  Los ingresos que percibe por esta actividad los utiliza para el sostenimiento de su familia. 

Magali desea comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales, con la finalidad de alimentarlos bien y que obtengan mayor tamaño y peso en menos tiempo y poder venderlos a la brevedad posible.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Magali is 27, married and has one son. She lives in her own home with her family in the district of Tambogrande in Piura, which is 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque. She lives in the rural part of the district, which has electricity service. 

Magali raises and sells sheep, pigs and poultry. To date, she has established many customers and has two years of experience growing her business. She has adequate space and pens to raise animals. The income that she has received from her business has helped her take care of her family. 

Magali wants to buy nutritious food for her animals so that she can feed them well and see them grow bigger and gain weight faster. She will be able to sell them more quickly. For this reason she is requesting a loan in the amount of 800 soles (USD300).

loans.use: To buy nutritious feedstock

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth P. is from the village of Sta. Ines, Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 36 years old, married and has one school-aged child. To make a living, Ruth owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop selling canned goods, snack foods, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. Ruth has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Ruth joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Ruth is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and biscuits. This loan will be her second from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods and biscuits

loans.name: Maria Antonieta

texts.es:
María tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene una hija de edad escolar.  Reside en una zona urbana marginal de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

María se dedica a la compra y venta de productos de belleza por catalogo, una actividad que viene ejerciendo desde hace más de 2 años en forma continua. Su modalidad de trabajo es a pedidos.  María tiene a la fecha clientela fija que la apoya por el trato amable que les da.  Con los ingresos que percibe de este negocio apoya a su pareja con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

María desea comprar más productos de belleza, aumentar su stock y venderlos, de esta manera incrementar sus niveles de venta y por ende aumentar sus ingresos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 400 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
María is 34, married and has a daughter in school. She lives in the city outskirts of Chiclaya, the capital of Lambayeque. 

María buys and sells beauty products from a catalogue, something that she has been doing continuously for the past 2 years. She orders products for customers by request. To date, María has established a solid customer base that supports her business because of the way she treats them. With the income that she earns from her business, she helps her husband with their family expenses. 

María wants to buy more beauty products, increase her inventory and sell them, thus increasing her income. For this reason she is requesting a loan in the amount of 400 soles (USD150).

loans.use: To increase inventory of beauty products

loans.name: Leonardo

texts.en:
Leonardo Z. is from the village of Santa Cruz, Magsaysay, Misamis Oriental. He is 22 years old, married and has one infant-aged child. To make a living, Leonardo owns and operates a specialized retail store selling seafood products, including fish like sardines and milk fish, in the local community. Leonardo has been engaged in his business for over three years and earns approximately 12,000 PHP per month from these activities.
In 2010, Leonardo joined Kiva partner, HSPFI, to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from HSPFI. This loan was used to purchase additional fish and as working capital. Leonardo is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fish to sell. This loan will be his second from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand his business.

About HSPFI
HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.
